title: 源視物語：梁耀忠點解堪稱政壇「Note7」？

text: 女主人懷孕後便被逼居於狹窄露台四年的白色小狗番薯，義工救出後重獲新生，昨日帶往新界動物醫療中心驗血、打針、洗牙及絕育。即使曾遭否非人對待，番薯仍然非常親人和活潑好動，視身邊路過的所有人都如好朋友般。創辦新界動物醫療中心的獸醫林健峯形容，番薯性格樂天，就算被傷害過，都不會對人失去信心。 番薯五歲的狗生，有四年缺乏愛，亦沒有受到適當的教育，當日救走牠的義工Yuko形容，牠太過好動，幾乎停不下來，會四處放尿，又會咬爛傢俱，亦試過整晚在叫，曾經有領養者打退堂鼓，所以她已安排訓犬師從頭教導牠。 這不能怪番薯，直到這些日子，牠才能再次自由和被愛，自然會對世界充滿好奇和將過去壓抑著的精力發出來。記者現場所見，番薯對所有人都十分友善，會主動親近旁邊的人，對人全沒戒心，獸醫也讚牠的樣子很可愛。 Yuko昨日帶牠到位於元朗馬田路的新界動物醫療中心接受驗血、打針、洗牙及絕育，該中心知道牠的可憐經歷，免去那些費用。驗血顯示番薯基本上正常，獸醫稱皮膚等也沒問題，只是牙齒缺乏打理，有很多牙石。 林健峯則表示，除了牙齒問題外，番薯的走路也不太協調，估計與長年腳部肌肉缺乏運動有關。他稱，不少狗隻受到傷害時，會對人失去信心，瑟縮一角，但番薯看來性格較樂天，所以沒有太大的心理傷害，對人充滿信心。他呼籲大家不要為了一時興起而購買寵物，亦不應遺棄牠們，要做負責任的主人。 番薯的絕育手術十分成功，Yuko希望下一步能夠教好番薯的行為，讓牠盡快找到愛錫牠的家庭。   原刊於香港動物報
title: 困露台四年仍親人好動　獸醫讚小狗番薯性格樂天

text: With the Constitutional Referendum campaign in full swing, members of the public are beginning to grasp the concept behind this movement, understanding the Basic Law must be reformed to achieve real democracy in Hong Kong. To that end, Civic Passion, Proletariat Political Institute and Hong Kong Resurgence have joined force to campaign for a five-district constitutional referendum. The plan is to win one seat in each of the five voting districts in the September elections and then resigning to turn the subsequent by-elections into a de-facto referendum to create a legitimate mandate to rewrite the Basic Law. These days, the whole world watches as China's economy tethers on the brink of collapse. While there is no telling when doomsday will arrive, we should be prepared for the inevitable and a constitutional referendum to decide the future of Hong Kong has therefore become an urgent matter. However, there has been very little discussion among Hongkongers on the ways and means to bring about such a referendum, how it may affect the political situation in the near future, or the upcoming Hong Kong Chief Executive election. In a recent episode of his radio programme, Passion Politics, Wong Yeung-tat (initiator of the referendum campaign) talked about these issues at length. Constitutional Referendum: a powerful bargaining chip in our dealings with Beijing According to Wong, a constitutional referendum can actually be seen as independence in action. Independence for Hong Kong is an issue that cannot be brushed aside in our fight for democracy. Back in 2013, when people were clamouring for universal suffrage, Wong argued that if we did not broach the subject of independence, no real progress could be made in our fight for democracy. At the time, Chin Wan's City State theory was already seen as too radical when it merely calls for the proper enforcement of the "one country, two systems" principle to keep Hong Kong separate from China. Wong believes that the democracy movement in Hong Kong needs a more radical agenda. Pushing for outright independence means that the relatively moderate City State faction will move into the middle ground, paving the way for real progress in the democratisation of Hong Kong. At present, the political arena in Hong Kong is divided between the pro-establishment camp, the pan-democratic camp and the localist camp. However, in an ideal world, the independence camp must also come into play to shake things up, resulting in a balance of power between the "compromise" camp (pan-democrats), the "City State" camp (the middle ground) and the "independence" camp (the radical faction). Hong Kong independence is now a hot topic, one that neither the pan-democrats nor the pro-establishment faction can afford to ignore. In the past, the pan-dems would not go anywhere near it as they believed that advocating independence would only provoke Beijing. These days, however, we are not just discussing whether Hong Kong should become independent or not. We are actively pushing for a referendum that will eventually put Hong Kong firmly on the nation-building path. Are the Chinese Communists jumping up and down now? No, far from it, they seem to be softening their tone. Last month, Chinese leaders such as Li Keqiang adopted rather mild language when talking about the Fishball Revolution that erupted in Hong Kong during Chinese New Year. Even the Chinese media remarked that a "warm wind" is blowing from Beijing towards Hong Kong.  "This just confirms what I've always maintained, that in dealing with China, you always need to up the stakes to strengthen your bargaining power. It is the only way to make them move towards a more conciliatory position," said Wong. Referendum campaign will strengthen Hongkongers' desire for independence The next step involves winning over international recognition for an independent Hong Kong by demonstrating that it carries the will of the people with a popular mandate. In Wong Yeung-tat's words, "if we think that a real revolution is inevitable, that we must now strengthen the people's resolve. If Hongkongers recognise that they have every right to amend the Basic Law, then their determination for nation-building will follow suit." For the past few years, through different channels, Civic Passion has been gathering the views of the public on the issue of amending the Basic Law. These days, as the campaign for the 2016 Legislative Council elections commence, the idea of rewriting the constitution by and for all Hongkongers is promoted in various places in Hong Kong, making the general public understand that many of the problems that they now face can actually be resolved if certain provisions in the Basic Law are amended. Notable examples are: Article 36 (governing the flow of immigration from China to Hong Kong), Article 5 (maintaining that Hong Kong remains unchanged for 50 years while making no provision for its future beyond 2047), Article 23 (national security provisions) and Article 45 (selection methods for candidates for the Chief Executive post). "If all the five candidates spearheading our referendum campaign triumph in the upcoming elections, they will be a force to be reckoned with. This is because they will have received a popular mandate from around a million voters who want the Basic Law amended. Remember, this mandate will have derived from the proper process of election, overseen by governmental agencies and public scrutiny. It is not child's play or some kind of online voting or street poll. It will certainly receive a huge amount of media attention," said Wong Yeung-tat. At that stage, the revision of the Basic Law will have received the people's mandate. This is because our five candidates carry the agenda of rewriting the Basic Law once they get into LegCo. Hence, the by-elections that result from their resignations will in fact be a de-facto referendum. The push for Basic Law reforms could become a major headache for the Hong Kong Communists, particularly when it comes to Article 1 (Hong Kong being an inalienable part of China). Any attempts to amend it will inevitably involve the thorny issue of Hong Kong independence. Next Chief Executive could face large-scale unrest if he rejects the result of a referendum By now, the new Chief Executive will be trapped in a real dilemma. If a million voters endorse our five candidates in the September 2016 elections, it will mean that our constitutional reform movement enjoys a huge mandate. The pro-establishment camp may vehemently reject the election results, but the Chief Executive will find it impossible to ignore the verdict of the voters. A possible scenario is that a large portion of the population will support the amendment of Article 1 (Hong Kong being an inalienable part of China), effectively calling for Hong Kong to be independent. If they are ignored, then many of them may decide to take matters into their own hands to make their voice heard. The government will find it hard to simply dismiss them as rioters. Besides, since the announcement of our referendum campaign on 29 February 2016, international media have shown a keen interest and the world will be watching us. Scenario 1: Next Chief Executive is a hardliner like CY Leung Wong Yeung-tat firmly believes that the Chinese Communist Party will view the referendum campaign with deep concern, and that it will have a huge impact on the choice for the Chief Executive post in 2017. Either a moderate like Jasper Tsang or a hardliner like CY Leung is expected to take over the post. Wong thinks it is unlikely that Beijing will appoint another hardliner. Firstly, with the Chinese economy on a knife’s edge, suppressing Hong Kong will only exacerbate the situation in China. Secondly, if China is serious about elevating their own position on the international stage, they will have to behave accordingly. Imagine if you have been told at work that you are being considered for promotion and a pay rise and, as the icing on the cake, the boss's daughter fancies you. Then, one day, a thug approaches you in the car park to pick a fight with you. In that situation, with so much at stake, wouldn't you try your best to make peace with him? By the same token, China will not want to risk everything by adopting a confrontational approach towards Hong Kong. "Even if a hardliner takes over from CY Leung, we will continue to press ahead with our constitutional reform initiative. Beijing will only have itself to blame for what is to follow," said Wong. Scenario 2: Next Chief Executive is a moderate like Jasper Tsang To avoid large-scale unrest, a moderate Chief Executive like Jasper Tsang or John Tsang will adopt a more conciliatory approach. "I'm positive that as long as all our five candidates win their seats in the LegCo elections this September, the new Chief Executive will need to undertake political reforms at once, because that will be his only option,” said Wong. In response, Beijing may also adopt a moderate stance and continue to let a "warm wind" blow towards Hong Kong and may be prepared to negotiate. However, at this point they will find themselves in a rather tricky situation. Our five candidates will by now have handed in their resignation in order to trigger a de-facto referendum in 2018 to rewrite the Basic Law. According to present legislation, they cannot be re-elected. Instead, we will be replacing them with five candidates from a younger generation. As such, Beijing will be at a loss as to who they should be talking to. Their "warm wind" will have been a waste of time. Wong believes that at that point there will only be one course of action open to the Hong Kong Chief Executive. He may try and diffuse the situation by collaborating with moderates like the Civic Party, claiming that Hongkongers are not interested in independence as it is an unrealistic goal. He may say that all we want is self-determination and that as long as the LegCo and the Chief Executive are directly elected by voters, there will no longer be any need for us to continue with our struggle. "When a moderate like John Tsang takes over, he will have to introduce political reforms straight away. Even if the initial proposals do not include a Chief Executive or a LegCo fully and directly elected by the people, I'm quite certain we will see Hong Kong taking a big step in the right direction, while we continue to push for the rewriting of the Basic Law," Wong explained. Conclusion   Ultimately, the choice of candidates for the Hong Kong Chief Executive elections will depend on Beijing's attitude towards Hong Kong. Our referendum campaign will no doubt have a bearing on its decision-making process. The pan-democrats argue that pushing for independence will harden Beijing's stance, making it more likely for a hardliner like CY Leung to be appointed as Chief Executive to suppress Hong Kong. Such a view is disputed by Wong Yeung-tat. Wong believes that the bigger the support for the referendum, the less likely it is for CY Leung to be given a second term in office. Chinese Version 中文版本: 公投制憲沙盤推演　黃洋達：五區公投將左右下屆特首人選
title: Constitutional Referendum: A Look At Possible Scenarios  Wong Yeung-tat: Campaign will influence CE candidates

text: 「這個不是煙，是加濕器的水蒸氣，我不吸煙了。」Angelababy 動作「俐落純熟」地回應網民。 見多識廣嘅朋友，應該一睇就知，女神手上嘅係iQOS；一款由煙草商推出嘅電子產品。而Angelababy 嘅回應，其實相當巧妙，充分應用邏輯學上訴諸無知謬誤去為事件解畫。正如當年有記者問Baby有無整容，佢答人話箍咗牙；同梁振英回應護老院虐老風波，話呢個係土地問題如出一轍。簡單嚟講，就係九唔撚搭八。 好，就用Baby個邏輯去諗，咁iQOS又係咩呢？「加濕器的水蒸氣」咁講，又真係冇錯嘅，不過並唔係事實嘅全部。iQOS原理係將特製煙芯加熱，釋出水蒸氣混合體，達致傳統吸煙體驗。iQOS產品最大賣點，係由於產品只將香煙加熱到特定溫度，但又未至於到達燃燒溫度，唔會產生焦油，所以無煙臭味，亦唔會對身邊人造成困擾。生產商聲稱，產品比傳統香煙少95%有害成份，減少使用者嘅身體傷害。換言之，假如用iQOS嘅係黃曉明，Angelababy 就算響佢身邊，都冇食到二手煙。 但依家用嘅係Angelababy本人，呢個「加濕器的水蒸氣」搞咁多嘢，其實純粹只係無焦油，但都有尼古丁成份，亦都係煙嘅一種，唔係點頂癮？尼古丁對身體有咩影響，唔我就費事google啦，但Angela個baby仲緊食母乳（好似係），少的化學嘢，點都係pure的，純的。 原本應該一早戒了，還是不捨得的尼古丁。當大家已經唔會天真到以為女神唔使痾屎，但現兜兜咁，睇住女神攞住支煙，再陶醉地吸啜又另作別論。母乳餵哺，係健康人生第一步，Angelababy 仲餵緊奶，尼古丁就真係對佢個Baby健康唔好。其他大人呢，尼古丁 or not 尼古丁，it is a question。Angelababy，雖然你選擇唔到遺傳啲咩俾你個仔，但至少可以選擇餵啲咩俾佢食喎。   則留言
title: 寶寶抽煙，但寶寶不說

text: 香港風帆代表鄭俊樑今晚在巴西里約熱內盧 Marina da Glória 碼頭對開，爭逐里約奧運男子RS：X型風帆獎牌賽，他在賽事中以第三名過終點，總成績排第八。 獎牌賽前，鄭俊樑排第九。由於是次比賽分數「雙計」，如發揮得宜，可以對拉近與前列的排名差距極大幫助。結果鄭俊樑以第三名過終點，以126分排第8。賽事由荷蘭的風帆手 VAN RIJSSELBERGHE Dorian 奪冠。 今晚稍後時間，香港男子乒乓球男子團體賽將會對戰日本，爭取準決賽資格。牛下女車神李慧詩亦已收拾昨晚意外炒車的心情，將出戰場地爭先賽。男子單打羽毛球代表胡贇將會出戰分組賽。而男子單車手梁峻榮就會在大約凌晨四時出戰全能單車賽當中的三項子賽事。 鄭俊樑在衝線時舉起左手慶祝。（TVB直播截圖） 鄭俊樑在今天獎牌賽排第三。（TVB直播截圖）
title: 【里約奧運】港風帆奪第八　獎牌賽鄭俊樑第三名過終點

text: 請支持《眾新聞》，成為訂戶 【撰文：若水】 作者 做過投行，現在喺一間創投基金做嘢，係一個九十後的金融／創投人 蔡東豪寫過四十五歲的抉擇，葉朗程話再早d，三十五歲就要抉擇。我話，你二十一歲就要面臨你人生嘅第一個大抉擇。我知，因為我經歷過。 迷思：趕不上時代的巨輪嗎？ 網絡照片 望住你嗰套畢業袍，你不禁對未來有無限得憧憬。 就嚟畢業嘅時候，唔係讀醫，又唔係讀law嘅你，總會羨慕吓邊個邊個拿到邊間跨國銀行月薪7萬嘅Offer（係啊，你冇睇錯，係月薪7萬，可能係你阿爸阿媽做足二十年都搵唔到嘅月薪），又邊個邊個拿到Big 3顧問公司嘅Offer，畢竟人哋做一年嘢飛嘅里數已經夠Marco Polo Silver Club嘅membership資格，得閒可以check in吓Bali嘅Client Office，又或者去吓法國advise吓個client要唔要買個酒莊。 當所有人都在趕嘅時候，你發覺自己如果咩工都冇嘅時候，直頭就唔好意思再見人，因為搵唔到工就好似愧對祖宗十八代祖先，老豆老母供書教學教咗個對社會生產力係負嘅廢人。 網絡照片 最慘係，周邊搵唔到工嘅人多的是，但係礙於面子問題，冇人會話俾你聽佢地自己其實都好大壓力。就係因為咁，你用以前讀書時候，化壓力為動力嘅心態，開始狂寄求職信。我親眼見過，一個讀所謂神科嘅朋友，狂寄100封求職信仲chur過馬明，只是為求搵到份工，唔好令老豆老母朋輩失望。 結果，這個教育制度下教科書式的完美產物，係香港都係一畢業就失業。 問題係，讀書一路順風，只代表你很會玩考試這一套有固定規則遊戲，僅此而已。考試成功，並不代表做嘢會飛黃騰達。The real world doesn't work this way. 簡單嚟講，每個啱啱畢業的人，對老闆來講，都係一個MVP，係Minimum Viable Product，根本就只係勉強能用，錯漏百出。話知你讀書讀到曉飛都好，你對公司嘅價值增值都係仲低過零，因為老闆要花時間教你。既然係咁，係假設請人成本均等的情況下，人哋與期要一個努力讀書，分數高但人脈一般的人，定係要一個讀書麻麻，但係有家底，幫到老細帶生意嘅後生？ 這個問題，唔駛我答你掛？ 所以，趕唔趕得上時代巨輪，根本同讀書勤力，考得好唔好毫無關係。故事教訓，如果你係一個一直努力讀書嘅好學生，但係都找不到工作，唔一定係你嘅錯。 抉擇：認清你的機會成本 網絡照片 讀大學嘅時候，個個商科生都有個做個中環上等人嘅夢。 有時睇吓ig，碌下facebook，見到俾你早幾年出身嘅師兄師姐影吓自己去咗邊度遊埠，去咗邊個遊艇船P，又「呻」下自己交咗幾多稅，這一切一切都令你覺得無論幾唔鍾意都好，你必須發奮找到一份係IFC返工嘅高薪厚職，如果唔係咁做，你見到嘅一切就成為你放棄嘅機會成本。更何況，讀書一向唔差嘅你，又點會接受人工得萬三？過時過節點同親戚交代啊？ 不過，冇人話俾你聽，比你打入中環做到iBank，做完Analyst/Associate，搵份糧都係唔夠供樓，因為有咁上下地位，就要配上咁上下價錢既地段。當然，呢個仲未減去你每逢禮拜五同d同事落Bungalow pop幾tray Champagne要埋嘅單。你嘅師兄師姐嘅FB同IG，同樣無話俾你聽，你係呢d睇落五光十色嘅行業挨足十年十五年，假設一切順利，升到做Managing Director/Partner/Department Head，你都最多只係做一個Net Worth唔過幾千萬，比上不足，比下有餘嘅專業人士。 唔係話做iBank，做專業人士唔好，但係如果你係為錢而做嘅，咁你就完全睇錯事實。 亦因為咁，你絕對應該趁年輕博一舖。 用Expected Value 計吓，走專業人士條路，只需要你考到某些專業資格，比如考到個牌的話，能當上會計師嘅Probability 非常高，但係expected return，包括你的工作滿意度同工資拉勻只是不過不失；如果你追隨你嘅夢想，成功的可能十個只有一個，但成功嘅回報係以億計。簡單來講，probability很低，但expected return奇高。二者對比嘅expected value唔敢講邊個高邊個低，不過後者嘅好處係，你今日就可以為你嘅夢想開始奮鬥，贏輸，都係自己嘅。 所以，你做中環上等人嘅機會成本，其實就係你Forgo嘅呢個upside。 網絡照片
title: 給快畢業／失業嘅你：二十一歲的迷思與抉擇（1）

text: 立法會財委會於2014年6月審議新界東北發展計劃，期間大批示威者撬立法會大門，13名男女事後被裁定非法集結罪成或承認非法集結罪，各被判80至150小時社服令。律政司認為刑期過輕，向上訴庭申請覆核刑期，案件今（14日）審理。律政司指，示威者是公然挑戰法紀，如果稍越過臨界點就變成暴動，認為除即時監禁外無其他合適刑罰，要求判處即時監禁。 控方代表於庭上播出案發當天片段，顯示示威者以竹枝等撬開大樓玻璃門等。律政司指，立法會當天設有示威區，警方也沒無理阻礙他們，惟示威者恃著人多勢眾，明知大樓內有警員，照樣衝擊。 控方陳辭指，立法會是法治的重要象徵，被告公然挑戰法紀，指當時情況嚴峻，或會越過臨界點即變成暴動，行為非常嚴重。控方指，當天衝擊造成立法院會42萬元財物損失及有保安員骨折，可見各被告的犯罪行為非常嚴重。 廣告 控方希望法庭發出明確訊息，做出如此嚴重違法行為會帶來嚴重法律後果，不能從輕處理，除了即時監禁，其他判刑都不合適。 控方又指，各被告原審時更表示自己沒有悔意，部分被告亦曾提出上訴，認為判處社會服務令並不適合。 廣告 至於上次聆訊未有到庭的其中一名被告招顯聰，今天亦沒出庭，控方指警方已用盡一切方法找他仍不果，控方希望可在招缺席下繼續聆訊，獲上訴庭批准。 13名被告依次為梁曉暘、黃浩銘、劉國樑、梁穎禮、林朗彥、朱偉聰、何潔泓、周豁然、嚴敏華、招顯聰、郭耀昌、黃根源和陳白山，他們已全部完成服務令。 相關報道： 明報／蘋果日報／無綫新聞
title: 【東北案刑期覆核】求判即時入獄　律政司指示威者挑戰法紀　恃多人衝擊或變暴動

text: 「唉屌～又係政治嘢…」Lunch時，隔籬枱OL咬住飲管，一臉嫌惡狂掃Facebook。 「係啦～Gary要離開Running Man喇～超唔捨得囉～」OL二號說。 「係啊係啊～」 梁、遊兩人宣誓事件，再一次成為星期三洗版焦點。點解總有一班人討厭政治，或不想理政治嘢呢？ 先唔討論「政治同生活息息相關、政治好重要、唔理政治正港豬」乜乜乜… 因為就算更深入討論，大家都無興趣睇。 好多人生理心理都唔想理，其實同點解鍾意買書，但買完返屋企唔睇，有時間反而狂掃FB、IG有關。 再講個親身例子，我寫一個故事，所花嘅心血同時間一定比起大家睇故嘅時間多。 但當乖乖讀者幫手share，或Tag朋友入嚟睇嘅時候，有時只會換嚟一句「TLDR」（太長唔睇）每次見到，我都覺得好hurt。 有好多人都以「唔睇字」「唔理政治最緊要開心」呢種無知為樂。 點解呢？就係因為呢班人個腦太正常！ 人嘅大腦有種特性，會幫你自動選擇一啲比較輕鬆、比較開心嘅事情去做。 例如玩Facebook、接收娛樂資訊、睇好多即食圖or片… 以上各種資訊，大腦只需要處於放鬆狀態就能夠解決，開心笑吓又一日。 但係睇字同關心政治，大腦一定要經過花時間思考、判斷、資訊過濾先得。 以上兩者作比較，大腦自然會選擇較輕鬆嘅一方去做。 所以大家鍾意睇面書多過鍾意睇書。 直覺認為多Like就係正嘢，少Like就可以唔理。 因為大家可以唔使用腦去判斷嘛。 可能你會話：「但係睇書學到多啲嘢喎～」 呢個亦關乎到「認知易用性」嘅問題，喺現代咁多種選擇嘅情況下，大家判斷一樣嘢有冇用。 會先睇吓佢易唔易用。 例如Facebook同Tumblr，即使Tumblr功能比較多，每個page首頁又個人化。但因為Facebook比較易用，大家又更易睇到，於是大家就選擇Facebook。而Tumblr淪為睇咸嘢嘅平台。 又例如，環保大家都知係正確、應該做嘅事… 但因為嫌麻煩，大家都唔願意去做。 睇書亦一樣，即使睇書得著比較多，但因為太耗時費勁，我睇一幅圖只需幾秒就引到我笑。睇愛情金句已經勾起我共鳴，做乜要花幾粒鐘睇一本書呢？ 最後再跳返返嚟政治，政治需要用力思考、好多判決力、少少哲學、又觸及到歷史、法律等等… 嘩咁多嘢，我做隻快樂港豬唔係開心得多咩？ 講返好耐好耐以前，有個哲學家提出「相對主義」（唔記得英文）呢個理論，佢認為呢個世界無所謂真理，因為唔同人、唔同情況下就會出現唔同結果或觀點。 聽落好似幾有道理，於是好多議員、政黨都好鍾意用呢套理論吸引人民支持，大家都覺得好溫和，又唔太需要思考對與錯，唔錯唔錯。 不過，因為大家都無一個確實嘅定論，漸漸好多嘢就變得「無所謂啦～多人認同就啱嫁啦～」「無所謂啦，每個人觀點唔同嘛，大愛啲啦。」「無所謂啦，唔好煩到我就得。」… 就好似現時嘅香港一樣。 成個社會都陷入一個無所謂啦嘅狀態，直至一個痴線佬出現，佢叫蘇格拉底。 佢為咗證明呢個世界上有真理存在，佢不斷搵好多政治家挑機，同佢哋進行辯論，甚至最後因「不虔誠和腐蚀雅典青年思想」被判死刑。 蘇格拉底係個痴線佬，佢到臨死一刻都無搬過龍門，就算佢班學生安排佢逃亡，到死前一刻都仲周圍搵人辯論，因為佢認為作為公民係必須遵守法律，如果因為怕死而臨陣退縮，咁同班相對主義嘅契弟有咩分別呢？於是…蘇格拉底堅持到最後飲毒汁死咗。 跟得阿公多，個人都變得長氣… 咁多字大家應該無咩心機睇。     最新出版：《港產童話》《如何激嬲女朋友而不失霸氣》 藍橘子   則留言
title: 又被政治洗版，好煩囉！

text: 成日講笑，Nokia 3310手機跌落地，撼爛嘅應該係地下，原來德國產Leica都做到！有大陸的攝影師係酒店三樓露台拿出他的 Leica M9 拍攝，點知突然有風，一跣手就將成部相機飛出去，跌到泳池旁的花崗岩石上。聽到覺得好肉赤？ 落樓下執返部Leica M9，旅客發現相機除了鏡頭遮光罩變形及刮花外，一切如常操作，對焦也沒有問題。但係地下花崗岩就崩咗一角。呢幾張相係微博瘋傳，不少網友大讚 Leica 質素果然高，不過也有人指出「重點是大陸製花崗岩」。
title: 德國Leica相機硬撼中國花崗岩！結果係……

text: Hong Kong’s political situation can be confusing at times as events whirl about in a never-ending maelstrom, but when seen through simple classic Sino-idioms, the absurdity becomes clearer and more understandable. These idioms are often in the form of short narratives, sometimes historically based, which explain the meaning behind the idioms, their origin, or sometimes the historical literature from which the phrases were coined. Below is an example which highlights a pressing issue in Hong Kong’s politics, especially for the pro-democracy factions. There are variations to the stories, but the example used here goes by the version used in an old Hong Kong cartoon show known as the Animated Gallery of Sino-Idioms (成語動畫廊). “Faking as a Piper to Enter an Orchestra” ( 濫竽充數 ) During the Warring States Period, the Kingdom of Qi’s King Xuan was a lover of the reed pipe ensemble. One day a scholar by the name of Nanguo applied for the position of a reed piper, except that he did not know how to play the instrument. Fortunately for him, the king didn’t bother to check his qualifications and admitted him into the royal ensemble, giving him a royal musician’s salary. This scholar faked playing the reed pipe each day amongst the other actually talented pipers until the day the king died and was succeeded by his son, King Min. The new king, however, preferred solo performances, so the fake piper made his quick exit before his masquerade was exposed. The moral of the story is that imposters will eventually be exposed. On Tuesday, 14th August 2018, Andy Chan from the Hong Kong National Party gave a speech at the Foreign Correspondent Club (FCC) luncheon on the controversial topic of Hong Kong’s independence. Prior to the event, the Chinese regime and its lackeys in Hong Kong – including the former chief executive CY “689” Leung – made a great ruckus against the FCC hosting Andy Chan and allowing him to promote the push for Hong Kong’s independence, with the Hong Kong media making out Chan to be someone of note. However, the following day after the luncheon speech, TIME published an article titled “Just Who Is Andy Chan, the Leader of Hong Kong’s Independence Movement?” The writer Casey Quackenbush recounted her interview with Andy Chan at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel and her impression of Chan’s speech at the luncheon. Anyone who has the most basic, high-school-level literacy in English reading comprehension will be able to tell that the author sees Chan as a waste of time. After an introduction on the history of the call for Hong Kong’s independence, Casey Quackenbush wasted no time in flattery as she immediately mocked Andy Chan as the unlikeliest of leaders for such a movement, by describing him as “charisma-free” and incapable of making an impression on anyone if it wasn’t for the Hong Kong SAR regime’s attack on the fellow. Quackenbush also made a point that activists in Hong Kong had called the Hong Kong National Party (founded by Andy Chan) a “statement party”, meaning that it talks the talk but has yet to walk the walk. To illustrate, Quackenbush revealed that during her interview with Chan, he was unable to name what and who inspired him to take on this path, when his “eureka moment” that convinced him to take up the cause for Hong Kong’s independence was, or what his future goals and directions are. She also revealed that Chan has little to no true understanding of what Hong Kong is about, nor does he have a battle plan. When further asked by the journalist why he is doing what he is doing, Andy Chan could only come up with the answer “I don’t want to waste my life”, to which Quackenbush responded with the punch line at the end of the article: “It might be too late for that”. In other words, the impression that Quackenbush got from Chan is that he is simply a load of hot air. Andy Chan’s lack of ability had been revealed in a prior BBC interview before this Time article was published. In the BBC interview, the journalist described activists in the Umbrella Revolution as “descending into violence”, and asked Chan if his Hong Kong National Party would do the same. Anyone worth his or her salt in the China-resistance camp should have immediately objected to the BBC journalist’s claim, as the violence was never incited by the demonstrators but rather orchestrated by the SAR regime, via their use of police and triad gang members to harass and attack the protesters. Yet Chan never made the effort to counter such a false accusation; instead, he attempted to distance his party and himself from any sort of “violence”. Why is there such a massive difference between the image of Chan as portrayed by the Hong Kong media and Quackenbush’s description of Chan? Simply put, it is because Chan has taken ideas from somewhere and someone else, and then claimed them as his own or his peers’. When put on the spot and he has to think on his feet, however, he becomes tongue-tied. He faked being a piper, only to be exposed high-and-dry when the tide turns. For the rest of us, we should take heed of Saint Peter’s advice in his epistle to churches in Asia Minor during his time: “Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do it with gentleness and respect, keeping a clear conscience, so that those who speak maliciously against your good behavior in Christ may be ashamed of their slander.” (1 Peter 3:15-16) How we are to do this is given in Deuteronomy 11:18-19, “Fix these words of mine in your hearts and minds; tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads. Teach them to your children, talking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.” In other words, we are to constantly think about why we are fighting for Hong Kong. We should mull over our opponents’ arguments and ways to respond to them. We should mull over our own arguments and ways to respond to those who challenge us. Don’t waste your time the way Andy Chan might have.
title: Political Gallery of Sino-Idioms (4): Reed Pipes and Hot Air

text: 就算依加影相有幾方便，都永遠唔夠一張即影即有嘅感動～日本富士率先披露將會係初夏登場嘅即影即有tote bag，其中一面會有15個相位，除咗即影即有之外，仲可以放其他卡片或者相，用家可以自己製造一個獨一無二嘅tote bag！
title: 即影即有tote bag即將登場 15個相位創造屬於自己的故事

text: （photo via cc Flickr user William Arthur Fine Stationery）   作為一個廢青，文學自然離自己很遠。 然而，每個人對「文學」都有不同的詮釋：村上春樹寫的係文學作品，馬克吐溫寫的係文學，金庸寫的係文學作品，所謂「文學」，不在乎客觀的字，只在乎主觀的心。 寫文章跟寫小說一樣，有的人喜歡幻想、真的喜歡評論、有的喜歡敘事，各有所好。然而，最討厭人說某種文體不是文學，每篇文章，每部小說，存在都有其價值，對筆者對說，就算是一個區議員寫的無聊愛情小品，也能吸引到人，那又有誰有資格去定義何謂文學。 文學呢，是個很好玩的東西，放在詮釋學上、放在哲學上、放在中文系上，可以是一個課程，一本書，甚至是一輩子的爭論。因為它根本沒有一個能滿足所有人的答案，所以為何仍爭其所爭？對我來說，只消是一件作品，它就可以稱作文學作品，只不過文學作品可以分很多種，你可以按其種類分，如科幻、紀實；也可以按其質素分，曾幾何時香港書展有些什麼藝人扮「才女」出書，這些就是垃圾文學的極致。 筆者絕對不是作家，因此，只可能眼看不同名作家的作品，但手中卻寫不出那樣的字出來。作為一個連意思表達都有問題的人，明顯不適合探討形而上的文學，有時，因為想像力不足，很難跟上作者的步伐，所以，對筆者來說，隨筆、散文是最難捉摸的。而小說、紀實作品則相對易掌握。 雖然上面我說隨筆、散文不適合我看，但通俗文學的話就可以。貼地的文學作品，只要能引起人的共鳴，那麼不論任何一種文體都會得到人的注意。如上所述，作為一個廢青，有種文體以筆者的智力都能夠寫到的，那是「潮文」。這種「潮文」當然不是寫給達哥讀的那種，而是一種貼近年青人看的文體，很多時這會有點幽默成份，內容可能與廢青、毒、摺有關，然而，有的也會與社會現象接軌，上樓、就業等等與年青人有關的問題。所謂「潮」，就係潮流之意。 另類「潮文」很多會在網上出現，各大投稿網站比比皆是，反而，傳統的報章、雜誌很少會有年青人寫這些文章。這是因為網上人人都是作者，而且傳統紙媒也未必對這些文體有興趣。但在網上，年青人最大使用層，也能找到很多志同道合的人，所以普通年青人選擇寫「潮文」。 我們小時候的文章，在現在某些人來說，是廢文。然而，對你來說，或者很有價值，那它就是文學啊。或者我說了這麼久「潮文」，你也不明白何為之。或者這樣說吧，「潮文」是你自定義的，一篇出於普通人之手，寫下普通的事，可能是小城小事，小情小愛，但能成文，就是「潮文」。 文章，每個人都可以寫，這並不是名作家的專利。   則留言
title: 俗談文學

text: 「... 自小便灌輸的不許批評黨，政府及國家，領導人永遠是對的「愛國」教育，其實某程度上和缺乏批判的奴化教育相似。它對年青人的遺害深遠，即是在完成大學學業後，有機會到國外的一流學府深造，也可能為時已晚。」 黃偉豪：《錢買到的只是學歷，不是智慧：從LSE的中國留學生說起》（4月18日刊香港01） 來自國內嘅同學，最大嘅優點，就係佢哋比較刻苦，比較勤力。但在接受新事物及適應轉變上，國內學生一般都較為遜色。另一個特點，就係佢哋一般都比較識做人，我試過有學生在端午節帶了一大盒家鄉的糭子給我送禮。我堅持唔要，講佢聽「我哋呢度冇咁嘅規矩」。我又話「咁樣做亦都對佢冇好處。其他人只會認為佢嘅好成績係靠討好老師，甚至係賄賂老師攞返嚟」。但係佢哋無辦法理解，覺得好平常，因為佢哋係國內，由幼稚園到高中，甚至上大學都係咁。 除咗少數，好多來自國内的同學唔係好能夠接受對中國嘅負面評論。佢哋又會大條道理，話其他人唔係喺國內生活，唔知道國內情況，又話香港人受到偏見影響。總之就係佢哋自己嘅經驗、感受及預先嘅定見先係最啱最準。 廣告 當然不能一概而論，但大部份確實如此。 我始終覺得，好多人話國內嘅同學比香港嘅學生優秀，完全只係偏見。香港的學生，其實好多方面比大陸學生更好，長遠發展潛質也絕對不會遜色。關鍵係閱讀唔夠深入唔夠闊，沒有國內學生那一股死勁。加上今日中國嘅經濟實力同埋市場大，普通話及國內聯繫便成為國內同學嘅先驗優勢。 廣告 香港嘅同學，亦都要加強自己嘅信心同決心。話大學專收國內同學都研究生，這個講法不盡準確。如果有得公平地揀，國內學生未必可以攞到咁多研究生學位。一方面係佢哋人數多，可能佔了申請入學人數的大多數，自不然獲得取錄嘅比例亦都會較高。另一方面，係有D香港嘅同學自己唔夠決心，以為一定唔夠佢哋爭，所以索性唔申請。所以呢一個假定變成了一個 Self Fulfilling prophecy。 當然，也不能夠否定大學今日嘅發展生態，亦都令到國內研究生佔有優勢。首先整個學術世界都重視對大陸的研究，本地研究要攞到經費，要發表文章往往較為蝕底。國內學生好多時申請研究課題已經較為容易吸引到導師。 另一方面，我親耳聽過有大專院校的同事咁講，佢話比較喜歡收國內學生，其中一個原因係可以叫佢哋幫手寫吓文章，而佢哋一般都唔會出聲，因為國內嘅同學嚟到香港，可能舉目無親，個性都比較順從。有個別學生也希望以此可以得到好處，例如可以攞到多D經費，去多幾次海外出席研討會之類。 如果係香港同學，佢哋點敢咁做。據我所知，喺國內留港研究生圈子，好多都心照，幫老闆草擬學術文章，向學術期刊投稿係佢哋日常工作一個部份。其實主要係個學生寫，個老闆可能只係睇睇，有啲甚至睇都唔睇，就叫學生做埋投稿嘅程序。有啲老闆識做啲嘅，會將學生個名加喺後邊作為第二或第三作者，當係幫佢哋儲資本，作為將來學生在學術圈發展之用。當然亦都有啲人大安旨意，總之就利用研究生到盡。這一種作風，當然也是當今大學發展趨勢，「要不就是發表文章，要不就是執包袱走人」。這種評核標準其實正在令學術圈加速腐敗。 我喺國內有一位朋友在重點院校任教，佢帶嘅研究生照計應該都係精英中嘅精英，但我親眼所見，佢哋不時會幫個師傅，或者佢哋叫老闆，做跑腿，處理埋啲個人事務，包括去銀行搞手續，幫佢執Office，甚至返屋企執屋等等。所以嚟到香港，其實已經算係唔錯。 至於國內學術圈嘅腐敗問題，真係講唔到咁多，寫多十篇都寫唔完。共產黨可以搞到啲學術圈、知識分子大部份都貼貼服服，當然係有佢嘅一手，仲有一大堆學術嘍囉，願意做共產黨嘅幫腔。在國內環境下，讀書人又或者叫臭老狗，嗰啲腐敗嘅劣根性仍然十分普遍。當然唔係個個都係咁，但係好多潛規則，少數有心人要打破亦都唔容易。能夠本着良心，做自己嘅事，不去學術造假已經算係唔錯。學生喺咁嘅環境下耳濡目染，其實亦都係整個政治體制、文化因素及制度塑造出來。 其實唔好話國內，香港嘅學術腐敗問題，其實也在惡化當中。上邊講嗰啲，只是其中一些例子。只要香港繼續大陸化，這個問題只會繼續惡化。 #黃偉豪：建基於買回來的學歷，而非真正智慧的「大國崛起」，也恐怕是鏡花水月，曇花一現，難以持久。 （原刊作者FACEBOOK）
title: 插了什麼稻，便收什麼米

text: 早前有網民留意到，教育局曾向全港中小學派發多份普通話課程配套資料，當中一篇文章引用中大普通話中心學者指「香港漢族人的母語是漢語」，粵語只是「地域變體」的方言，普通話才是「正規的語言教育」。楊潤雄今日回應指，文件是2013年之前已上載，屬一系列的文件之內，為了向老師提供不同學者及人士對母語的看法。 他指小學教育都是以廣東話為主，足見政府在教學語言上的立場：「政府在這件事上，何謂母語、非母語，若看回我們在小學的教學，大部分都是用廣東話，除了英文等個別科目。小學教育都是以廣東話為主，可以清楚見到在教學語言上政府的立場。」 改革通識科？楊潤雄：暫未收報告 廣告 對於政府是否有意改革通識科，楊潤雄指在教育上多個方面都正進行檢討，其中一個小組正就課程設計向政府提意見，檢討包括不同科目所佔用的時間及內容。不過他指暫時尚未收到小組的報告，因此不知道在細節上的建議，呼籲外界給予時間空間小組與業界討論。 《星島日報》今日引述消息，稱教育局擬改革通識科，或將文憑試改為只設「及格」和「不及格」，甚至將該科剔出核心科目，改為選修科目。教育局局長楊潤雄今日回應事件時未有證實消息，稱暫未收到小組的報告，因此不知道建議詳情。 廣告 被問到是否因為受到太多批評而要檢討，楊潤雄指，「到今日為止，我們沒有說過要改，但課程最後目標都是要幫助學生一路成長」。他又指作為負責任的政府，是會就教育課程進行檢討，出發點是令學生學得更好。
title: 【粵語非母語？】楊潤雄：向教師提供不同看法　小學教學以廣東話為主　足見政府立場

text: 唔講唔覺，原來呢個Page已經面世左一個月啦！多謝大家一直嘅支持！唔知有無人係好鍾意食香蒜呢類比較重口味嘅野食？今集薯毛毛決定帶大家食得重口味少少，睇下今次呢份香蒜巴馬薯條係點先！ 講真，好少見到薯條 X 香蒜呢個組合，當侍應姐姐將碟薯條上枱個陣就已經聞到好重嘅蒜味，就已經好想令我去快啲食下睇下係點樣。一食落去，確實係蒜味好夠，而且薯條即使係幼身都好，薯肉都好飽滿，絕對無偷工減料，至於佢地嘅蜜糖醬都唔錯，只係覺得個份量唔係太夠，呢度比較可惜左啲。 廣告 總結下評分先： 廣告 薯條Size：幼薯條 價錢：$48 賣相：3.5/5（單睇賣相唔算話好吸引，但蒜味夠強，較重口味者應該會幾鍾意） 薯條質素：4/5（即叫即炸，薯肉都好飽滿，炸出黎都唔會覺得好油） 醬汁/調味：4/5（蒜味同蔥故然夠入味啦，蜜糖醬都唔錯，只係個份量少左啲要扣分） 性價比：3.5/5（整體唔差，只係個份量同個醬略為少左啲，無奈之下要扣分） 選擇餐廳性質：由於餐廳比較細，屬於快餐類型，1-2人比較好。另外，佢地嘅Burger都幾好食，算係落足料，值得去試下。 呢間舖其實係位於天后個邊，想睇古蹟附近有天后古廟，想睇書就可以過返去香港中央圖書館，再唔係，食完覺得飽想去散步嘅話，可以去返維園都可以㗎！ 今集《今日薯條睇真D》去到呢度，臨尾要多謝返Gordon Ho嘅推介！唔知其他朋友又有無心水推介呢？歡迎大家留言話俾薯毛毛知啦！拜拜！   餐廳：Texas Burger 地址：天后電氣道109號地舖   作者 facebook page
title: 今日薯條睇真D（第六集）

text: 請支持《眾新聞》，成為訂戶 看倌外遊想必一早安排好行程交通，預期有個愉快的旅程吧。筆者上月中因事到紐約處理並短留數天，只能在辦事外的空閒匆匆與朋友到幾個景點，行程也不由自己安排，經歴了一趟不期而遇的紐約遊。就在沒有期望之下，卻又令我有一番感受。 感謝當地朋友和教會招待，筆者若不是處理事務或觀光，就會在布魯克林區（Brooklyn）第八街出入。該處聚居華人，不算十分繁華，體驗相當在地。霎眼一看，滿街中文招牌和耳聽的不是普通話就是廣東話或是福州話，若非有英文路牌還道自己在國內某二三線小鎮。友人不少也是移民，笑謔他們把家鄉也帶來了。 因恐襲倒塌的紐約世貿雙子塔遺址，建成911紀念博物館。碑上刻著的是死難者的名字。美聯社 到埗第二天筆者到了世貿遺址博物館。毫無疑問 911 是改變美國甚至世界歴史的事件，在當代就為這事件做一個小結本身已經不容易。當中展出遇難者的個人物品和對話、整個事件的始末和時序等。行畢全程讓筆者感到沉重卻不煽情；以團結為結尾而不硬銷愛國信息。無論你持甚麼立場，也會受其氣紛感染。參觀當日並非假期，但也看到不少青少年入場參觀。911 可能在他們出生之前已經發生，而參觀和認識歴史事件將成為他們身份傳承的一部份。 Museum of Modern Art展覽一角。維基百科截圖 離開前一天趁空檔到了現代美術館（Museum of Modern Art）參觀。筆者是美術的門外漢，幸得甚具藝術造詣的朋友同行導賞。常人只道美醜是主觀好惡，但藝術工作者卻自有一套美學論述。不少現代美術品用上了非藝術材料，幾幅相、幾件東西的組合也可以是藝術品，對欣賞的人有一定要求。而令筆者注意的是展廳牆上或一些藝術品的介紹上，均有贊助人名字，其中一個最常見是洛克菲勒（Rockefeller）家族成員。筆者曾聽說從十九世紀末美國有暴發戶開始就從歐洲購買藝術品以附庸風雅，培養了新一代藝術家也提升了民眾欣賞藝術的水平。 紐約的天際。美聯社 離家的我其實十分想家，但離開紐約時也不禁思考移民的問題，這次旅程卻讓我有新的體悟。對比香港的擠迫和急促，紐約是一個不失繁華而又舒適的地方。我觀察到小孩在街上自由的奔走，坐著設計安全的校車上學；看到國家願意面對自己國殤和過犯，並以此教育新一代成長；發現有錢人願意花錢買賣自己藝術品以建立自家品味。回望香港和大陸，君不見高官叫市民繼續飲鉛水；記念仁川地震的牧師被捉拿、記者被打；富豪一樣移民走資，沒有建設家園的心態。在大國的主旋律下，生如螻蟻的小市民仍然沒有被統治者重視，只以為改善物質條件就夠，怎教人不想移民？ 近幾年不少同輩的香港人也移民了。其實誰人想輕言移民、離鄉別井？筆者明白香港人的難處，只能說我們累了、失望了，只是想自己和下一代過得好，難道是錯嗎？當然異鄉同樣問題多多：當地人對外人的歧視，也有移民向筆者訴說一個「異鄉人身份（alien ID）」對他身份認同的障礙。不能美化移民為解決問題的截徑。 終歸今日筆者仍不想移民，只能寄語香港人把一切失望和落差成為改變香港的動力，為香港邁向公民社會繼續出力。當政者也應思考如何建設一個小市民幸福的國度，否則所謂大國堀起只是破牆上的口號而已。
title: 不期而遇紐約遊

text: （非劇評！）   呢期追緊Game of Thrones第七季，最近兩集真係睇到把幾火。   明明有三條龍、有艦隊、有Unsullied、仲有Dothraki，應該大舉進攻King’s Landing，搵條龍噴下火，一陣就搞掂Lannister啦。 明明Tyrion一直好討好㗎嘛唔明，今季做乜大愛左膠上身，要先攻Casterly Rock，再圍困King’s Landing，要唔傷害平民，令大家知Daenerys先係血統純正嘅皇后，嚟到King’s Landing亦唔係害人，只係拎返皇位，帶更好嘅生活畀人民。 講就好聽，但佢似乎唔記得King’s Landing豬根本係見風駛舵，無人理你血統，無人理你係咪好人，總之邊個贏就為邊個歡呼，歷史亦係由贏嘅人寫。   仲有呀，你對手係好暸解你、會睇穿你嘅Jaime，仲有癲嘅Cersei，記住呀，係癲架，你都佢講大愛，未講完，佢一把火燒死你啦。真心唔明點解Tyrion可以咁天真覺得可以逼到Cersci交個皇位出黎。   大愛左膠嘅野我諗我呢世都唔會明。   則留言
title: Enough for clever plans!

text: 唉，我已經患上遊戲障礙症一段時間了，每天起來就是看新聞想論述 — 或許這也是個遊戲 — 以至於我對真正的大作總是提不起勁，買了也玩不下去。我覺得我太沉迷於現實了，這是個很不好的症狀。 我總覺得，一個人如果失去了少年時的興趣，那他同時也會失去少年的自己，失去一些柔軟的、有變革希望的想像力。（當然這樣的興趣未必是電玩。）最近身邊這樣的舊識越來越多了。想到有點感傷。 為了維持有點中二的自己，把這當成畢生的信念去實踐，我逼迫自己去嘗試一些真正好的遊戲。好像透過螢幕、手把、還是鍵盤滑鼠，可以建立渠道，通往十幾歲的自己。好像那少年時的空間、氣息、說不上來的樂觀與抑鬱，可以跟此刻的我互通。我覺得這至關重要。 廣告 但渠道的建立並不容易。光是「好玩所以去玩」的這個想法，對現在的我來說就像山頂上的燭火，一陣風過來說「還是多想想怎麼賺錢吧。」過一會又來「你就算全成就達成又能證明甚麼？」我始終默默忍受，一直到它說「你只是想逃避現實吧！」我就受不了了，對這陣風吼說： 「我Ｘ你Ｘ的ＸＸＸ，你以為自己有甚麼了不起啊，當一個無聊的大人很厲害嘛？我跟你說，你捨棄人性去追求的那些名位，那些利益，在我看來只是你不想承認自己其實很平凡，並且因為拒絕承認平凡而變得庸碌的矯飾偽裝而已。」 廣告 吼得過癮，身邊的燭火卻也熄了。 越來越難建立渠道，走進過去的世界。那裏有些很幼稚的習性，很愚蠢的世界觀，卻也有些寶貴的資產。 有時候我是在逼自己玩遊戲。玩那些必須心神凝聚，感受到獨特心靈體驗的遊戲。（當然不是那些課金手遊。） 為了逼迫自己，我開始在玩「買遊戲的遊戲」。買遊戲不一定要馬上玩，就當作是結個緣，像是放在書架上的經典名作，今天不看，明天也可能會看。如果一直沒翻開，那就是緣分沒到。不能強求。 我想，有安裝steam的玩家，應該能理解這種佛系的想法。 尋尋覓覓，遇到多少無緣就不說了。我終於玩到一款超好玩的獨立游戲《Celeste》，中文名稱叫《蔚藍》。是四五個加拿大人做的。天啊，這麼小的工作室，可以做出這麼偉大的作品！在大企業大組織當道的世界，這真的是活生生的勵志傳奇啊！ 前陣子當紅的電影《一級玩家》，裏頭有個關卡很明顯的是跟「平台遊戲」致敬。我不知道Platformer這個分類方式是何時開始的。我小時候，瑪利歐、音速小子、高橋名人冒險島、洛克人、音速小子......都被歸類在動作遊戲（ACT），還沒有Platformer這個說法。 總之在一級玩家那個平台跳越的橋段，我忽然想到在我小的時候，真的是平台遊戲的黃金時期。80年代，你能做出頂尖的平台遊戲，就能成為世界頂尖（而且超級有錢）的遊戲公司。 但是隨著科技進步，遊戲的表現法（畫面與操控性）推陳出新。當代的主流（所謂的大作），就是具有一定開放世界觀的3D動作RPG了。就是你只能操控一隻角色，在3D的世界裡跑來跑去做些奇怪的事的那種。某個意義上，遊戲跟現實越來越接近了。我們不也在現實世界裏，操控著一隻不聽使喚、外貌也不盡如人意的角色，在3D的世界裡跑來跑去，做些奇怪的事嗎？ 在電子遊戲的發展趨勢，往現實世界逼近的時候，Platformer這種2D的遊戲，就顯得太歷史悠久了。 畫面不夠擬真、不夠華麗、不夠震撼。 一直死掉重來，挫折感很強。 感覺太老派......?! 我原本也有這種感覺。即使我全破過紅白機的瑪利歐，洛克人也破了幾代，但我不是個靈巧的玩家，那種神技一般從頭到尾無損全破的youtuber影片，我只能遙遙仰望而已。我已經失去了，在平台上上下下反覆墜落重來的耐心。 我開始玩《Celeste》，初衷不過是佛系。 但是這個小工作室做出來的遊戲，是歷史級別的優秀。它把Platformer這種違反發展趨勢的遊戲形態，從墳墓裡拉出來，還給了它一雙翅膀。 《Celeste》如果能在三十年前做出來，遊戲史會改寫。但即使放在今天，它依然是頂尖中的頂尖。 這遊戲在改寫你腦子裏，對於失敗重來的看法。 遊戲中的死去，極其頻繁。掉落深淵、碰上尖刺、被敵人追撞......大部分的遊戲時間，你都在死掉重來。但是它把關卡切割得很小，死去並不需要重走一大段路。音樂不會因為死亡而重新播放，讓你把死掉重來視為遊戲「正常遊玩的一部分」。 《Celeste》會紀錄你死亡的次數，把它視為經驗累積的象徵，是熱情，也是榮耀。 我想到灌籃高手裏，櫻木練投的那兩萬顆球。 我們小心翼翼的控制著呼吸。節奏。這一切都有關著節奏。每一個關卡，就是在仔細嘗試並控制節奏。有些人天份好，掌握得快。平凡如我，慢慢試，也能關關過。 遊戲的體驗，是世界的縮減。只剩下跳躍與攀爬。你也只能專注於此。生命沒有那麼多的苦痛，沒有那麼多的不得已，沒有那麼多的想得而不可得。只要你想，你去做，一次一次的去試，你就會做到。 而途中的失敗，都是遊戲寶貴的體驗。 蠻幹是不行的。每一個小關卡都有巧思，都有某些絕竅要掌握。你得嘗試各種可能的路線跟技法。有時候，難的是你想不到解法。但更多時候，難的是你手指跟不上。 失敗沒那麼可怕，只要一次次去試就好。要靈巧的去試，要改掉錯誤的解法習慣。 遊戲不需要跟現實證明甚麼。那些現實的名利法則，很多時候是偏狹的，是扭曲的，會減損人的本質。但是，如果遊戲要有甚麼現實意義的啟發的話，它所能承載的意義，遠比主流認為的巨大。 我覺得，即使短期看並非如此，但只要時間拉長，世界終究屬於那些，反覆跳躍，攀爬，永不言棄的玩家。 （標題為編輯所擬；原刊於作者 facebook）
title: 頂尖中的頂尖遊戲 — 玩《Celeste》的初衷不過是佛系，卻改寫了我對失敗重來的看法

text: 雖則話警民關係近年轉差，但睇嚟都幾多人投考呀……（撰文：甘樂宜） （圖片來源：police.gov.hk）
title: 督察投考人數創新高　夏季招聘日接860宗申請│甘樂宜

text: 站在那分割線上的位置，莫文蔚推出了全新專輯《我們在中場相遇》。新唱片分為上下半場，「上半場絕世經典組合再現，下半場絕妙驚奇組合上演」；可於唱片未發行前，本人聽了她和相遇不久的李榮浩合作的《慢慢喜歡你》之後（李榮浩在她的上一張專輯中，已經參與了結他的演奏），便有所懷疑這下半場的新陣容，到底和本身「善變」的莫文蔚，能一起產生什麼比新組合噱頭更「絕妙」、「驚奇」的東西出來。 然而在方大同主理曲編的《絕》之中，莫文蔚像脫掉專輯上半場那令自己走得小心翼翼的高踭鞋一樣，變得更靈動、更自由地穿梭，不同於她上半場表現的成熟，或是在伍佰& China Blue炮製的《中場沒有休息》內，如唱著「用力 再用力……」時的不太能應付自如；此曲中的莫文蔚，好比還未遲暮的少婦，有著特別之韻味，又不失青春的光彩。接著MATZKA創作的《Dancing in the Rain》，帶來了維持他正面樂觀、讓人能不斷扭動之特色的音樂，奔放像南美式的足球踢法，以享受泥濘、"Dancing in the Rain "的想象畫面，帶出接受或享受逆境、從中得到解脫的信息，也繼續把之前困在大氣壓內般的Karen，解放了出來。 新專輯的下半場，重點展現了莫文蔚她仍可以輕易遊走於不同音樂風格的能力，Karen就像一名出色、全能的足球員，既有著如前鋒進攻時的「放」（ 《絕》、《Dancing in the Rain》），亦可做到後衛防守時的「穩」（《慢慢喜歡你》）；在華晨宇作曲的《半生緣（我們在這裡相遇）》中，她開始時沉著地演繹，到副歌忽然突擊般的轉變，再於後段排山倒海式的編曲下發動之「攻勢」，可守可進，好比優秀的中場。風韻猶存的莫文蔚，還是能靈活地扭著她的小蠻腰，跟一眾「小鮮肉」諧和地「共舞」；張藝興出招的《不待續》，前奏簡單但給人留下特別的印象（又貼上了張藝興個人的標籤）， 之後繼續「發展」的音樂，延續了前奏已預示的中西合璧之特色，像幾分鐘的花式足球秀，（編曲）技法流暢自然，亦像剪裁得好的旗袍，很貼合Karen本身婀娜多姿且性感的形象，是專輯內較為有驚喜的一首。 而由李榮浩幫忙去煲「雞湯」的《慢慢喜歡你》，延續著莫文蔚於《寶貝》後喜歡的溫情路線，用慢火熬出了非加入雞精的味道來；李榮浩應該是想著楊丞琳所寫的一氣呵成般的長句子，顯得質樸但情真（喜歡「綠瓦紅磚柳樹和青苔過去和現在都一個樣，你說你也會這樣」此句），在音樂的烘托下，更有奇異的慰藉之感。新專輯不少歌的歌詞著實很是一般，可靠曲編的「撐著」，或Karen的演繹，勉強能被「填坑」；而跟莫文蔚合作無間的李焯雄，聲稱想說的內容很多、卻最後選擇精煉的方式來表達的《半生緣（我們在這裡相遇）》，若沒有音樂上的情緒補充，即會顯得較為空洞（或你也可以認為這是李焯雄的高明之處，讓豐富交集的情感，藏在了不言或音樂之中）。 專輯《我們在中場相遇》，表現出莫文蔚音樂上的廣度（寬度），卻非深度；從絕妙、驚奇的方面來說，她以前玩過更令人feel so絕的東西，且一班新合作的音樂鮮肉或半臘肉，並未為她帶來什麼突破，像各自的散打（雖則這唱片有基本的概念框架）、令專輯音樂上的豐富性顯得較為表面式。於我角度來看，此專輯還不如Karen的上張、沒有那麼繽紛的《不散，不見》，可以更有鋪陳地，挖掘出她情感內更深層的一面。 群星拱照的《我們在中場相遇》，於上半場的踢法更為沉悶。李偲菘製作的《如初之光》是引子，具點題的功能（在「默問蔚藍的天空是否」的歌詞內，還藏著莫文蔚的名字）；但作為一首唱給自己的作品，總覺得它缺了些真情的溫度，歌曲內容像主旋律式的口號，有點空泛。而融入巴哈《Prelude No.1 in C major》作前奏的《I Do》，或是屬於齊豫所在之空靈派系的《天一半 地一半》（剛好前面一首《飛》的作詞人便是三毛），只從單曲來聽，並沒有什麼問題，可當它們組合在一起，便令到整個「上半場」的感覺較為「平坦」、平淡，如自己隊友於球場中場相互傳球的沉悶時段，基本上沒有將莫文蔚前半生起起落落、反平坦、反固定於某一種形態的音樂精髓表現出來（伍佰& China Blue炮製的《中場沒有休息》，算是活躍了氣氛，但這歌放於《天一半 地一半》之後，顯得轉折突兀、編排失當）。 眼前火熱的世界盃，四年一度才舉行，而莫文蔚近兩張專輯，也是相隔四年才發行，可這新的唱片，並不是一張值得等待那麼久時間的作品，有點可惜。莫文蔚希望以新專的上半場來做總結，下半場來發掘自己新的可能性，然而兩part都是噱頭大於實際（下半場稍為有少少火花產生），最多只能證明Karen在駕馭多元的曲式上，寶刀未老。有時球星雲集、個個技術不錯的球隊，未必能贏得比賽；但若相互配合出色的話，縱使低調如小國冰島，也能賽和阿根廷，甚至可以走得更遠！ 首選：不待續 評分：6.5/10 廣告 廣告
title: 慢慢不喜歡妳，莫文蔚

text: 紅十字會係一個國際性嘅慈善機構，多年來為香港市民默默係背後付出，提供各項醫療服務、統籌各區捐血中心嘅工作。本人同家人更加因為之前不幸入院而接受過輸血，而醫院每日成千上萬包血液均來自紅十字會的捐血服務中心。今日見到有唔少人以小人之心度君子之腹，唔單止唔識知恩圖報，反而借啲謠言係度造謠生事，唯恐天下不亂，比小人更加無恥。筆者依篇文就係回應銀行中女之前對紅十字會嘅攻擊。 第一， 中女指出紅十字會官僚主義，開放時間不利市民，擺出高高姿態當香港市民係賤民趕住去捐獻。筆者估計中女小姐係消費主義上腦，依家你去捐血，唔係係五星級大酒店享受桑拿服務啊！ 第二，中女小姐話香港有十六萬公務員，只要叫到其中一啲人定期捐血，就可以確保血源充足。依個論調簡直就係將中女自私自利嘅扭曲心理發揮到極致。沒錯，紀律部隊嘅責任係服務市民，但你又憑咩要全港紀律部隊嘅人承擔曬所有捐血嘅責任？用中女嘅邏輯，不如叫埋個十六萬人捐埋份糧出來養起所有窮人，咁香港咪唔會有人攞綜援同生果金囉。更何況，捐血救人本來係一件崇高同義不容辭嘅事，每一個香港人都應該承擔呢個責任。依家叫你捐出小小血去幫助下醫院嘅病人啫，又唔係要你條命，舉手之勞嘅嘢點解唔做？ 第三，中女小姐建議不如叫留係香港嘅一萬二千內地生每年捐血，就足夠滿足血液嘅缺口。我想反問中女小姐，你點知內地生無捐血貢獻？筆者這個學期曾去到大學內的捐血服務中心，看見也有不少操國語的同學在捐血。而且，問題嘅核心係點解一定要內地生捐？香港夠有五萬菲傭、印傭啦，人數更加多，又唔叫你提議佢地去捐？到時家傭成為捐血大軍，一齊來個港人家傭大融合，家傭順勢攞埋香港永久居民身分，其樂融融也！ 如果你咁討厭紅十字會嘅捐血服務，我希望你可以言出必行，以後有咩頭暈身㷫，出血個啲，都堅決唔好輸血啦！因為個啲血係係你口中所謂嘅賤民身上榨取嘅，你呢啲自以為「清高脫俗」嘅人係唔配享用我地呢啲賤民嘅心血。今日吾軀歸故土，他朝君體也相同，希望你講嘢之前用下自己嘅大腦。最後，我祝中女小姐身體健康、長命百歲。
title: 回銀行中女關於紅十字會的繆論

text: 北京市大興區月中一場住宅大火導致19人死亡，北京政府藉機清除「低端人口」引來爭議。昨日寧波亦宣布開展「大排查大整治」，明言分租房屋是檢查重點；廣州亦宣布對分租房屋等進行整治，並「堅決清理違規住人現場」。有關消息令人擔心，清除「低端人口」的措施，已從北京蔓延至其他城市。 浙江寧波昨日發生爆炸，造成最少兩人死亡十九人受傷。中國寧波網報道稱，昨日浙江省寧波市委副書記、市長裘東耀下令，全市立即開展大排查大整治，堅決消除各類安全隱患。 裘東耀表明要全面深入開展大檢查，檢查重點除了有消防、道路交通、油氣管線之外，亦包括分租房屋以及待拆遷地塊，又揚言要以「鐵的紀律、鐵的手腕、鐵的決心」，整治安全隱患。 廣告 廣州：堅決清理違規住人現場 另一方面，《南方都市報》亦刊出報道，稱入冬以來火災形勢嚴峻，廣州要開展分租房屋及「多合一」場所專項整治行動。報道指，近期火災都有共通點，就是發生在城鄉結合部、城中村地區，事故建築多屬「三合一」場所且有違規住人。 廣告 消防部門將開展摸底排查，針對分租房屋及「三合一」區域開展集中整治。對於小檔口、小作坊、小娛樂場所等「三小場所」、新興的「淘寶村」及物流工業園區容易出現違規住人的地方，當局會「堅決清理違規住人現場」。 在北京，清除「低端人口」的做法引來不少爭議，京官似乎正著力為事件降溫。北京市委書記蔡奇來到火災，要求穩妥處置好火災事故善後工作，「無論是本地群眾，還是外來務工人員，都要關心他們，妥善安排好他們的生產生活出路」。他又要求專項整治要體現人文關懷，要講究方法。 北京市大興區月中一場住宅大火導致19人死亡，北京市政府藉此展開「安全隱患大排查、大清理、大整治專項行動」，有關部門將數以千計外來基層民眾驅離家園；網上亦有相片、短片流出，見到公安拆毀家園、不少基層民眾在嚴冬無家可歸等情況，網上更廣傳在市郊一幅「清退低端人人有責」的橫額，引發全國多名知識份子聯署譴責有關行動。雖然北京當局否認「驅趕低端人口」一說，但翻查資料，有關思路近年已有跡可尋，而習近平親信、北京市委蔡奇上任後，更將其視為重點工作，進一步嚴厲執行。
title: 清理「低端人口」措施蔓延？寧波、廣州宣布整治分租房

text: 唔係曲線唔係反問。係設問句嚟嘅。 我明白香港入大學非常唔簡單，十個人只得兩個可以入到資助學位。同其他已發展地區比真係難到癲。有啲朋友讀書唔叻但係死都要經asso / HD / top-up 各種途徑入大學，我知道一般大學生正常嘅諗法係： 「好心讀書唔掂你就出嚟做嘢啦！」 但實情係，如果能力不濟嘅人，或者真係應該求其搵間大學（就算係遙距課程都好）讀咗佢。反而叻仔叻女嘅就想點都得（睇返我講十八歲結婚論）。 因為其實讀唔到大學嘅人入面（亦即係近八成嘅香港學生）入面有無數嘅勁人，如果你本身唔掂，學習能力同社交能力都弱嘅話，你拎住DSE都係做炮灰。而本身如果你規劃能力唔夠嘅話，你要用自修嘅方式去讀返書，就算俾多三五七年你，你都未必考得好DSE。與其留喺度永續輪迴，倒不如求其是但搵個 degree 讀咗佢。讀 degree 一來係令自己學返多少少嘢，二嚟，係以你嘅能力，有 degree 都未必搵到工，冇 degree 就連入場券都冇。 慶幸世界上有唔少嘅資訊失衡，唔少人依然覺得學位係有一定嘅保證，所以一個本身冇乜能力嘅人而言（假設短期內唔會爆seed），噉拎住個學位都叫做有啲揸拿吖嘛。 如果大家自知係 ① 學嘢慢 ② 語文能力弱 ③ 懶 ④ 唔識考試 ⑤ 唔識同人溝通，噉恭喜你，你喺谷底，無論你向邊方面進發，你都只會向上。搵間二線少少啲遙距大學讀下啦，唔好執着要入香港嘅大專喇。香港嘅大專渣極都有個埗，唔係咁易 hea 過㗎。攞咗個 degree ，再搞掂上面呢五樣缺點都未遲。 不過如果你屋企有錢？噉梗係去浸鹹水啦～屋企有錢冇得輸。   則留言
title: 點解能力唔夠嘅人，反而要讀大學？

text: 中大換心男馬倬朗昨晚不幸離世。港島西醫院聯網總監陸志聰對事件感到傷心難過，並透露馬倬朗找到合適心臟時，其他器官已不太好。中大新亞書院院長黃乃正教授亦對馬倬朗離世表示深切哀悼。 陸志聰今日向傳媒表示，馬倬朗自從換心手術後一直危殆，其中肺部情況最差，出現細菌感染，最近多個器官亦衰竭。他稱院方已盡力，如有需要亦會協助馬倬朗父母處理身後事。 陸志聰感謝捐贈心臟予馬倬朗的病人，希望市民不要因為事件影響支持器官捐贈的熱誠，並強調馬倬朗及其家人，都很想大家維持捐贈器官的決心。對於有意見指馬倬朗太遲換心，陸志聰稱這有待主診醫生作分析。 中大新亞書院院長黃乃正教授今日亦在facebook發文，稱馬倬朗於昨晚接近10時，因多器官衰竭，不幸於瑪麗醫院離世，「本院同仁謹致深切哀悼，並向倬朗家人致以懇摯慰問」。 20歲的中大生馬倬朗，今年六月因末期心臟衰竭，急需換心續命，其後獲一名去世者遺愛捐心，可惜6月中旬進行換心手術後，病情反覆。瑪麗醫院證實，馬倬朗昨晚十時因多個器官衰竭，終不敵病魔，於瑪麗醫院離世。 相關報道：香港電台／商業電台／星島日報
title: 馬倬朗病逝　院方稱換心後一直危殆　籲公眾續支持器官捐贈

text: 【Text by Jen Calleja】 "Poets have long been questioning the usefulness/uselessness of the label 'prose poem.'" When I was invited to create a miniseries of semi-regular author events as translator in residence at the Austrian Cultural Forum London, I wanted to make sure that the Austrian author would always be in dialogue with a British counterpart about something they have in common in their writing. My motivation is to juggle the foreignness and uniqueness of German-language literature with where it meets and overlaps with literature written in English in order to show that writing comes from a specific linguistic, cultural and literary context, but one that connects and communicates with others. As journalist Judith Vonberg summed it up in her review of the event for Literaturhaus Europa: “it’s a simple but unconventional idea. Instead of highlighting the differences between British literature and literature made on the continent, the starting point is similarity, which opens up far more interesting discussions.” The first of these events brought Austrian writer and musician Carolina Schutti and author and illustrator Joanna Walsh together to discuss poetic prose and how poetry permeates their writing in terms of language, effect and form with me in the ACF London’s Salon back in February. As a writer of both poetry and short fiction, I’m interested in why sometimes one form does and then other times won’t do at all, and why it sometimes happens that I can read the poetry and prose of others interchangeably as if in the other form. What are the markers and where is the boundary? (Read more)
title: Variations on a Theme: Carolina Schutti & Joanna Walsh on Poetic Prose

text: The verdict of Brock Turner infuriated America and the rest of the world on June 2nd, when Judge Aaron Persky leniently sentenced the rapist for merely six months behind bars. According to Persky, a moderate sentence was to avoid “severe impact on” Turner, who was a swimmer for Stanford University. Backlashes occurred immediately as the media reported the event. Activists and ethnic minorities in America accuse the sex offender for enjoying his white privilege, comparing Turner’s crime with less serious offences conducted by non-whites that resulted in magnitudes of time in prison. While the western society may be shocked by the Santa Clara County court, Hong Kongers are becoming more and more nonchalant to a system that favours Chinese mainlanders over the locals. In 2012 Zhang Wen-Chang（張文昌）, a mainlander university student in Hong Kong, called Hong Kongers “a class of people with low qualities”, “physically ugly” and “dogs” despite receiving more than 580k Hong Kong dollars (75k US dollars) from the local taxpayers. Reports flooded local media and Facebook, attracting thousands of requests to remove the imperialistic Chinese supremacist from Chinese University. Not only did the university take no actions, Zhang later blamed his critics for being intolerant. On the other hand, Singapore was adamant in defending her people. Earlier that year, the Singapore government sent a Chinese mainlander student home and stripped away his scholarships after he had made a video mocking the country for having “more dogs than people”. Zhang’s controversy was only one of the hundred unjust cases in the past years. For example, on June 3rd mainlander student Chen Tien-en（陳天恩）was given a 14-day sentence with a two-year probation for being guilty of three cases of theft. According to Chen’s attorney, Chen will continue his studies in the United States and was merely under too much pressure when committing the crimes. In contrast, a local woman was given a 6 month sentence for stealing something less than 20 US dollars from an H&M. Academia in Hong Kong receive their fair shares of absurdities under the Chinese rule. In May, Hong Kong University agreed to take no actions against mainlander chemistry professor Yang Dan and her team for the problematic paper submitted to chemistry journal JACS. Dr. Roger Hoi-fung Wong first reported to the university that he was not able to repeat Yang’s results. Yang not only denied she was involved in fabricating the lab data -- which mysteriously disappeared during the investigation -- she also accused the whistle blower for altering the data. The university concluded that Yang was unaware of the any fabricated results, though other evidence suggests she had reviewed the data herself before the paper submission. Only a few days ago, two men involved in the protest against mainlander smugglers in 2015 were sentenced to six to nine months in prison, respectively, for possessing chili oil. A lady, appearing to be swooning with her nose bleeding, made international headlines when the judge sentenced her for attacking the police with her breasts during the same protest. Maybe these protesters do deserve to receive higher sentences for being Hong Kongers and for protesting against Chinese colonialism. It’s no one’s fault that the protesters were not born as white men in the US nor mandarin speakers in Hong Kong.
title: Chinese mainlanders are Hong Kong’s Brock Turners

text: 林建岳：「大家看到，《十年》今次沒有得到任何獎項提名，亦非最賣座，證明不具備最佳電影的質素。《十年》成為最佳電影對電影人來說不公平，是政治綁架了專業，將電影評獎活動政治化了。」 《十年》唔係"一"套戲，係"五"套戲，五組人員去為一個主題來創作，除咗講求整部電影團隊合作的最佳電影外，點樣得到其他獎項提名呢？唔通將《十年》分五個故事來提名嗎？ “亦非最賣座"呢個仲好笑，先唔好講最佳電影一向唔一定賣座，只係講一樣嘢：《十年》得幾間咁少院線肯上，明明收得都院線不多，搞到最後大家要喺街睇，咁樣都有六百萬票房，你話唔賣座？幾多人想睇都買唔到飛？ 咁點解咁少戲院上？呢啲咪就係電影活動政治化囉！點解九七後冇乜政治諷刺電影(表姐果啲呢)，呢啲咪就係電影活動政治化囉。點解一個演員表達吓個人政治意見，就兩年冇工開？呢啲咪就係政治綁架了專業囉。點解演吓"選老頂"，杜文澤要擔心以後都冇戲拍呀？呢啲咪就係政治綁架了專業囉！ 你唔好吓吓用自己的政治取向(如果真係有)嚟睇，將人哋的專業評獎政治化，用你的政治取向綁架了人哋嘅專業先得㗎。 （題目為本報自擬）（圖片來源：蘋果日報）
title: 葉一知網誌│不要用你的政治取向綁架人哋嘅專業

text: （資料圖片、香港民族黨Facebook） 就有人以「香港民族黨內部消息頻道」的用戶名稱，在手機通訊程式Telegram發訊息指，民族黨會支持某幾個立法會候選聯盟，並號召民族黨支持者出席今晚在添馬公園舉行的競選造勢大會，香港民族黨今日（廿八日）發聲明澄清並沒有呼籲支持者出席今晚的造勢大會，並表示在今次選舉中不會支持任何一位候選人或有候選人參選的組織。民族黨強烈譴責事件，指責該頻道是偽造，並強調絕無發放上述消息及呼籲。 民族黨在聲明中同時闡明，該黨並沒有邀請青年新政及相關聯盟參與八月初於添馬公園舉行的「香港獨立集會」，為假消息所提到的「民族黨償還上次出席獨派集會之人情」一事闢謠。 民族黨強調，該黨於當屆立法會選舉中不會支持任何候選人或相關組織，呼籲民族黨及陳浩天的支持者，於是次選舉中要持獨立思想和行動方式支持港獨派，「切勿含淚投票」。
title: 民族黨澄清：無呼籲支持任何候選人或參選組織　譴責偽冒頻道發假消息

text: Joshua Wong Is Patriotic. Not Surprised. But More Importantly…Translated by Cesar Guarde-Paz, edited by Chen-t'ang, written by Lewis Loud [Originally written in January 2015] Original: http://dadazim.com/journal/2015/01/drama/ Joshua Wong said that a revolution needs ammunition, and a “revolution” was different from the the sacred umbrella in their hands; afterwards, he joined the TV programme “Face to Face”, where he reiterated that he was patriotic or, otherwise, he would not go to Victoria Park’s candlelight vigil for June 4 Tian'anmen Massacre. The whole picture can only be grasped when these remarks are taken all together. There were many slogans at Admiralty’s Occupy “Big Stage”. “Do not forget the original intention” is one of them. They prefer “Umbrella Movement” than “Umbrella Revolution”, and they say it’s because there was no ammunition. Again and again, they reiterate the importance of being patriotic. All of these are a hidden confession to the authorities of their true motive and position: We are not engaging in a revolution to overthrow this regime. It is just a crowd moving across the streets. We are patriotic. Beijing or our mother country, please don’t forget the “true intentions” that we Scholarism and the Hong Kong Federation of Students from the Pan-democracy Camp have. We do not actually wish to do anything! What are the “real intentions” that should not be forgotten? When they stormed into the Civic Square, even Joshua Wong himself could not have predicted that a movement by a small group of citizens would have been handled by tear gas, causing Hongkongers to take the roads for two months without reaching a mutually satisfying state in the end. Now that the movement is over and the low-pressure politics has been emerging, Joshua Wong, related the treatment he received in the police station to his future, naturally would not want the Communist Party to take him as the culprit of the disorderliness of the Occupy Central on September 28, of the in Hong Kong society, of the humiliation the Communist Party has suffered since then or of the turmoil among the factions in the Party. “Don’t forget the original intentions” The original intentions of Benny Tai and others were to get arrested in October to achieve a greater, faster and better result, while the original intentions of Joshua Wong were to get arrested after a few people stormed into the Civic Square. But Hongkongers will not sit down waiting for their “leaders’” performance. When the tear gas was deployed, the situation became out of control, and the Hongkongers occupied everywhere, leaving Admiralty for Causeway Bay, Canton Road, and Mong Kok. The attitude in the “volunteers” and the “pickets” from Admiralty attempted to permeate these places, however, the mass stayed there against these people’s dismissal suggestion. That is when those from Admiralty started to utter things like “we need to remember the original intentions”. Or in translation, it means “we didn’t expect to go this far!” Joshua Wong is a patriot. No need to be surprised. As for Joshua Wong’s self-declaration of patriotism, Ko Wai-yin, a columnist, also expressed her opposition. It doesn’t surprise me at all. Right at the beginning of the establishment of Scholarism, founders such as Joshua Wong and Agnes Chow stated in an interview by “iSunaffairs” that they have deep feelings towards China and the June 4 Massacre (See note 1). It can be said that the members of Scholarism and that of the Hong Kong Federation of Students are fundamentally not different from the Greater Chinese democrats (the Labour Party, the Democratic Party, the Civic Party, the League of Social Democrats and so on) in terms of the attitudes towards China. In a party, you always find the shadow of another parties, and vice versa. In 2011, Fred Lam stated his opposition against attacks to the Democratic Party. Joshua Wong supported him on Facebook. While Agnes Chow appeared in an anniversary dinner of the League of Social Democrats, a pro-Greater China party. This is their nature, and there is nothing to say about it. Patriotism is the nature of the Scholarism and the Hong Kong Federation of Students, as well as the Pan-democrats. Therefore, it explained their hatred against the word “umbrella revolution” and their fear of the uncontrolled masses (in Mong Kok, Causeway Bay, Canton Road, and those who expect the updated means), which are their true patriotic intentions — Do not work against China. But when you get raped by it, remember to cry a little so as to show your “conscience” and “character”. Do not anger the Communist Party!Everything goes back to the Associate Professor of Sociology at CUHK Chan Kin-man’s words on the reason to initiate the Occupy Central campaign: Ever since the political reform in 2011, the middlemen have stopped contacting them. Therefore, they engaged in the Occupy Central campaign wishing that Beijing would listen to their concerns (EJ Insight). The “Big Stage”, the international journalists, the artworks, and many other demonstrations exist because the nature of this movement is a show. Precisely, it was a play for Beijing to see, somewhat hoping Beijing to take a step backward -- be it changing the original mindset for real or merely for saving face. The so-called “original intentions” in them were like a helpless woman begging her father-in-law to take his orders back in ancient Chinese world. It was a mild persuasion, rather than a confrontation. The last thing that woman will do is to anger his father-in-law; similarly, the last thing these parties will do is to anger the Communist Party. It all makes sense then to see them against people’s idea, online or offline, to stop them from launching a protest or upgrading their means on the celebration of the Chinese “National Day” -- all of them work like a human chain preventing citizens from being out of control. By understanding the patriotic stance of Scholarism and the Hong Kong Federation of Students -- do not anger the Communist Party -- it simply becomes clear to people as to why their actions are consistent. “Do not forget the original intentions” is after all an empty slogan. They termed it as “original intentions”. Reason being that they know how unacceptable it would be to many if they are being truthful as “let us all make a show under the premise of not angering the Communist Party”. It doesn’t sound good. So they keep shouting “Do not forget the original intentions”. This slogan is in their favour. At least innocent citizens may have thought “original intentions” as some pure/truth-seeking measures without demanding for further explanations. Only their counterparts will know what it truly is. After all the diligent work during these two years as a follow-up of Occupy Central, Chan Kin-man said with relief that after September 28, Hong Kong has come to understand “our city does not have the capital for a revolution.” Correct me if I’m wrong. It sounds to me that he’s saying the whole point of Occupy Central was to inform Hongkongers how useless confrontation is. Alex Chow, the former secretary general of Hong Kong Federation of Students, as well joined the escalation to prove how useless escalation can be. Same logic, same choice of word, they are both "moderate” pan-democrats, who have a tendency to surrender. The comments of Alex Chow, Chan Kin-man or Joshua Wong towards revolution are intertwined with each other -- unless you are one of them, whatever you do are wrong and useless. You are just another Szeto Wah After one Szeto Wah has finally passed away, a new Szeto Wah has been reincarnated in the figure of Joshua Wong. Voldemort are so powerful that, after death, it can divide the human soul into different parts. This is called human soul fragmentation, and thus his soul was separated into three political bodies: the Hong Kong Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China, the Hong Kong Professional Teachers Union, and the Democratic Party. Similarly, the also patriotic Long Hair Leung Kwok-hung is just another one. And the young Joshua Wong is also one of those patriotic folks defending the Chinese democracy front for the Chinese democratic movement. Everything they ever did, therefore, is to avoid making the Communist Party mad. Under this framework, all their actions are reasonable indeed. Back in the day, Szeto Wah will repress the “three strikes”, namely the workers’, students’, and the shopkeepers’ strikes, after the June 4 Tian'anmen Massacre memorial, stopping Hong Kong from “losing control” and distancing himself from the “motherland”. Today’s Joshua Wong handled the abortions of the National Education protests and the Umbrella Revolution -- comparable to his predecessors. Szeto Wah was secretly in deals with you-know-that regime and was maintaining the democratic movement and self-awareness in Hong Kong to a controllable extent. What Joshua Wong is doing now, added with his words and deeds, is not so different from Szeto Wah. People like Szeto Wah and Joshua Wong are popular to the mainstream “audience”. With a great political energy, a strong fund raising ability, a great deal of blind yellow-ribbon fans, and also the endorsement of Jimmy Lai – they basically have what they want. In the following chapters of Hong Kong, if the situation remains this way, surely ”democracy” will take us another 30 years… without a guarantee of success for certain, if you know what I mean. Sacrificing Hong Kong in the name of China had happened. Although in the new high school system, history is not a compulsory subject, if we are unfortunate enough, we might see Joshua Wong making history again… just like Szeto Wah did in the past. Note 1: Original text from the interview by “iSunaffairs”: Joshua Wong said, “Why do I want a Tian'anmen Massacre vindication? It is because I long for democracy in China.” He believes that June 4 is just a checkpoint, and if the government refuses to admit it, China would not have achieved democracy. “There is still a bit of freedom of speech and freedom of association in Hong Kong. so when Hong Kong can still commemorate June 4, we should stand firm and from there fight for Hong Kong’s democracy and for China’s democracy.” Some may feel that it has nothing to do with Hongkongers whether China has democracy or not, but Joshua Wong said, “First, you have to admit that you are Chinese, and since your life happens to be in this piece of China, anything that happens in China will eventually have an effect in Hong Kong. Thus, whether or not China has democracy will have an effect on Hong Kong’s possibilities for democracy. The June 4 vindication is an opportunity for Chinese democracy, so a peaceful June 4 is also important for every Hongkonger.”
title: Lewis Loud: Joshua Wong Is Patriotic. Not Surprised. But More Importantly…

text: 【前言】 香港嘅樓上書店、小書店難做到嘔。我已經唔想研究係乜嘢原因－租貴、閱讀風氣差、某一兩個作者啲書太多錯別字令人無意慾買書…… 為咗鼓勵後生仔去樓上書店買書，而家你去買書、我課金畀你。 呢個活動嘅主旨，一嚟想培養返佢哋嘅讀書興趣（起碼知道呢個世界有樣嘢叫樓上書店）、二嚟係想大家支持下啲小書店。 【領取資格及課金】 －呢個活動只限25歲或以下人士領取。25歲以上嘅人，有一定經濟能力，呢少少錢就算罷啦 －收取嘅課金以每張單計算，每人每單$50 －每人每月限領課金一次、活動期內限領課金兩次 【適用書籍及書店】 －先買書，後領便當......呀係領課金 －可以購買任何書（除旅遊天書、教科書、精讀）；中、英文書皆可；書籍不能轉售 －買嘅書只可以喺2014年或以前出版（以初版計算） －呢個係用嚟支持樓上書店/小書店，本書必須喺小書店購買。即唔可以喺三Ｘ、商Ｘ、中Ｘ、誠Ｘ等大型或連鎖書店。個列表不能盡錄，唔該使用你嘅判斷力。 你中意咪去大書店買囉，不過冇得拎課金之嘛！ －大家可以喺呢個貼tag你所認識嘅小書店 要申請同了解其他詳情，請用呢張form。 ─── 早幾星期有報導話銅鑼灣開益會執，我已經諗到呢個campaign。不過好多嘢忙，而家先正式推出。 呢個campaign暫時玩三個月左右，總資助上限係$20,000（有$5,000來自捐條毛做善事、$3,000來自前排hktvmall入code個event；hktvmall個event另外$3,000收到錢會捐去無國界）。餘數應該由我自資。 我唔係純粹出於好心。前排收到稅單，對我打擊好大……與其交稅畀689，不如拎啲錢玩下嘢，平衡下個心理。再者，我兩本書喺某一兩間樓上書店特別好賣（特別係旺角同老銅嘅開益），佢哋有乜咸魚白菜，對我都有影響。 如果未夠三個月就爆quota，好事嚟，到時我會再搵啲大孖沙注資。 ─── 嚟緊一段時間，我會請一班朋友提供佢哋嘅心水書單。大家中意嘅，咪睇住個書單去買書。 至於我自己呢……我其實係唔睇書嘅，所以我窮盡腦汁先諗到以下幾本值得推介嘅書： －《賣桔者言》，張五常：祖師爺親撰，最好睇、最少廢話嘅經濟書，將經濟學日常生活化，好易入口。 －《動物農莊》(Animal Farm, George Orwell)：神書。反烏托邦、反共產黨、反獨裁主義的諷刺小說。深入淺出。同樣題材嘅有《Road to Serfdom》，Friedrich von Hayek，不過後者好難明，堅難明。 －《挪威的森林》，村上春樹：呢本書要睇幾次，由十八歲重複睇廿八歲，你先知村上春樹想表達啲乜。呢本唔係村上寫得最好嗰本，但呢本有一個優點：短。 －《那些年，我們一起追的女孩》，九把刀：賣青春回憶同共鳴，小說中的九把刀才接近人類，電影與事實不乎地痴情。 －《A Complain Free World: How to stop complaining and start enjoying the life you always want》，Will Bowen。教你點樣唔好麻怨同投訴。This is a book that changes my life significantly. －《FBI教你讀心術》(What Every BODY is Saying: An Ex-FBI Agent's Guide to Speed-Reading People, Joe Navarro)：萬能插蘇嚟，由溝女到談判都用得著，值得一睇再睇、甚至背晒佢。 －《婚姻這種邪教》，史兄：講笑啫。同埋呢本書斷咗貨啦，咁易買咩。 －《李天命的思考藝術》。唔好理佢而家講啲嘢嘅豬o翕程度係咪等同長頭髮嗰個天命，呢個本將哲學喺香港普及化，應記一功。 滄海遺書： 《Black Swan》(Nassim Nicholas Taleb, 唔係Natalie Portman嗰套戲)《武道狂之詩》，喬靖夫（睇咗四期好睇到爆） 《超人間失格》，月巴氏 ────────────────── 關於個買書回水計劃，你有乜嘢問題，可以喺專頁或個人戶口發訊息問我。 畀你問渣喎，我無話答你。哈哈哈哈哈。 要申請同了解其他詳情，請用呢張form。 ────────────────── 另看立場新聞〈香港獨立書店地圖〉   香港獨立書店地圖：http://bit.ly/1GAhFVZ香港出版業和書店向來經營不易，近日有關傘運書籍消息，讓大眾再次注意到三聯、中華、商務書局三大中資書店在香港書籍零售市場的壟斷局面。面對「三中商」封殺和租金壓力，撐獨立出版、撐獨立書店，需要集體行動。《立場新聞》整理香港獨立書店最新資料，如有遺漏、錯誤、過時，請讀者指正， 我們會持續更新。#獨立書店 #樓上書店 #立場新聞 #上書局Posted by Stand News 立場新聞 on Monday, 9 March 2015 原刊於作者 facebook page
title: 你買書，我埋單

text: 新政府首份財政預算案，將於下個星期三公佈。由於庫房水浸，外界預料政府將錄得 1,500 億盈餘，於是各路人馬，又再主張全民派錢。然而，財爺陳茂波已經言明，有再三督促他們，不要為了博取掌聲派錢。至於特首林鄭月娥，則沒有明言派不派錢，只是強調港府需要審慎理財，香港過去只做過一次「無目的地派錢」。從這句說話中我們已大致了解到，奶媽並不主張派錢。 講真，政府不肯派錢，其實是意料中事，如有人覺得陳茂波跟薯片不一樣，不是為地產黨服務的守財奴，這是幼稚。神奇的是，今次竟然有建制派的政黨主張派錢，例如民建聯、工聯會和自由黨，反而是部份泛民主派在反對派錢。至於那些反對派錢的理由，則是講來講去三幅被，不外乎是：派錢刺激通脹，又或者派錢幫不到真正需要的人。 先不論怎去甄別何謂真正需要幫助的人，甄別又要多少行政費用，回歸至今已二十年，政府坐擁萬億盈餘，政府若有心幫助真正需要的人，要做晨早做咗啦？究竟是什麼莫名奇妙的原因，使那些人仍能這麼樂觀，繼續天真地相信這個偉大的特區政府，不派錢的話，便會拿錢去做一些正經事呢？這跟相信李嘉誠會「無目的地派錢」，又有什麼區別呢？ 廣告 更神奇的是，聲稱派錢會刺激通脹的人，轉頭其他形式的資助措施，例如根據網媒《HK01》的報導，政界盛傳政府將會向長者或低收入家庭派「利是」，上限 2,000 元。這種如同生果金、綜援出雙糧的措施，難道又不會刺激通脹不？至於聲稱派錢幫不到有真正需要幫助的人，又會主張退稅，擺明益中產和有錢佬。他們是否想告訴大家，派錢窮人有份拎，而他們不是需要幫助的，反而是中產和有錢佬才需要幫助呢？ 當然，我們只是一介平民百姓，不論怎樣支持派錢，也是沒有用的。現時唯一能夠逼使政府派錢的，便只有立法會議員。難得今次建制派三個政黨，都跳出來支持派錢，加起來已有22票，若是建制派的田北辰和謝偉俊都肯支持派錢，便有24票，而非建制派除公民黨和梁繼昌之外，民主黨、街工、工黨、教協、人民力量，連同朱凱迪、鄭松泰，若肯支持派錢的話，便有 18 票，為何不來場傳說中的「大和解」？ 廣告 若是建制派夠膽的話，願意跟非建制派聯手，加起來便有 42 票，超過立法會過半議席。他們只需提出政府不肯全民派六千的話，便會否決財政預算案，才能逼使政府讓步。畢竟，香港回歸以來，從沒試過財政預算案被否決，林鄭甘願成為香港史上首位預算案被否決的特首嘛？我相信，奶媽不願留下這一惡名。 問題是，建制派敢嗎？這便要看建制派，西環乃至北京有沒有政治智慧。愚見相信，北京本身其實是不反對派錢，否則澳門派錢派了那麼多年，早便被阿爺喊停了。問題的一切關鍵，在於北京是否明白，建制派其實毋需事事撐政府而已。派錢又不是廿三條，不牽涉國家安全問題，若是這樣仍要強逼建制派幫政府抬轎，不是等於自己親手玩死建制派嘛？
title: 不如「大和解」，齊齊逼政府派錢？

text: 有時一大班朋友去CAFE，幾PAIR情侶玩遊戲，女朋友無論贏定係輸，都係笑嘻嘻咁，表現得好大方。不過如果同我兩個人玩，情況就完全唔同晒！係完全唔同晒啊！ 佢好似絕對唔容許自己輸畀我咁，點解喺外面同其他人玩就可以笑嘻嘻，對住我一輸幾局就變身做母夜叉！點解？！ 「唔知點解，我輸畀你我就特別唔忿氣！」 同女朋友有時搭緊車，或者食飯等緊位時悶悶哋，都會搵啲小遊戲解吓悶。除咗前幾篇介紹過嘅『扮唔識』之外，仲有啲普通少少嘅。例如手機小遊戲咁，當佢處於劣勢，就會撥開我隻手，激動啲甚至會成部手機搶走…直到確保自己贏，先至畀返部手機我。 另一個經常玩嘅遊戲，就係每人放一隻手喺枱面，猜包剪揼，邊個贏就打對方，輸就要縮。起初都玩得好守規矩，但戰況越來越激烈，女朋友就變成贏又打，輸又打… 打都唔緊要，佢仲要縮起另一隻手。即係我又打佢唔到，佢贏同輸都要打你。 「唔玩呢個遊戲啦，妳贏同輸都打人嘅。」 「係啊～」女朋友好坦誠咁答我。 又有一次玩大富翁，兩個人玩大富翁其實好易分勝負，見地就買一定無死。不過咁，女朋友真係惡過地產霸權… 「唔得！唔准買呢度！」 「吓點解？」 「呢個地區刻咗我個名！」 最後，女朋友用：「你鍾意海，畀長洲你。我鍾意山，同我換太平山！」為理由， 我好快就破產… 究竟女朋友係有頭腦定係奸狡？！我分唔清… 有次叫我教佢玩象棋，喂大佬啊！象棋係屬於男人嘅世界，係一場戰爭啊！我點可以輸呢？所以我決定唔讓佢，殺到佢片甲不留！點知，真係人算不如天算，天有不測之風雲，玩咗無耐女朋友已經毫無還擊之力，就喺呢個時候… 棋盤上出現咗一隻腳！ 無錯！係一隻腳！ 我女朋友嘅腳！ 「呼呼呼呼呼呼～」佢嘴裡發出吹風聲，再用腳掃走晒上面啲棋… 「做咩啊？！」我問。 「有龍捲風吹襲，所以你全軍覆沒…」女朋友答得非常認真。我望住飛晒出棋盤嘅士兵，腦海不禁幻想千軍萬馬被一個巨型龍捲風捲到半空再跌返落地變成肉醬嘅慘況。 我認輸，對住龍捲風，有乜辦法唔認輸呢？ 點解每次玩遊戲，女朋友總係出茅招，務求要贏我為止？ 因為佢知道，同外面嘅人玩，佢唔可以咁做。 但係當兩個人，對手係我，我就會讓畀佢贏。 佢知道就算我輸咗，都絕對唔會發佢脾氣。 但佢會。（細細聲）   －－－－－－－－－－－－－－－   前幾日出版：《無病你呻乜嘢吟》 14/2（日）簽書會：3:00pm 鑽石山荷里活廣場３樓三聯書店 即場買本《無病你呻乜嘢吟》 預早買記得帶，會送獨藍特製繪馬牌。 ig：BlueGodZi 藍橘子   則留言
title: 同女朋友玩遊戲，千祈唔好贏！

text: 《議事規則》一役未能引起香港人關注，民主派須總結經驗，反省抗爭策略，並以此為基礎，部署3．11立法會補選。中共與上屆特區政府無恥地聯手利用人大釋法和本地法庭，DQ了六位一人一票選舉產生的民主派立法會議員，一巴掌狠狠地打在數以萬計選民臉上。3．11補選的主旋律，必定是將民主派參選人送入立法會，填補被DQ議員的空缺，修復否決權，不讓保皇派獨大為所欲為，要還以一巴掌，還以顏色。不過，經「修議規，反拉布」一役，民主派應該明白，只是這樣叫陣恐怕不足以動員最多香港人出來踴躍投票。因此，3．11補選的副旋律，該是民主派善用所有專業和專長，聚焦推動一些可行的安老、房屋、教育等攸關民生的政策，讓選民憧憬民主派在立法會恢復隊形後，不再是一支只會拉布的團隊。我們堅定捍衛香港核心價值和「一國兩制、港人治港」的同時，也能使香港人生活得比現在幸福。與保皇派的3．11對決，成功關鍵在於民主派參選人能否連成一線，集中力量和聚焦論述。常記司徒華先生言：「成功不必我在，功成其中有我，於願足矣。」個人在選戰中勝利，不代表運動成功；但一場運動勝利，每個支持民主的人都是贏家。民主派陣營有必要更加團結，審時度勢做得民心的事，才能打好3．11這一仗，一場許勝不許敗的硬仗。原文載於《明報》時代版（2017年12月21日）
title: 梁家傑：還以顏色的補選

text: Source: 一日之計在於晨的facebook page Yesterday a few of my friends shared either English or Chinese version of Emily Jones’s post in the above about the critique of horse racing, which seized my attention to read it in order to see whether there is any new reasonable argument in this issue. However, after reading it, I was very disappointed about it not because of Emily’s stance but because of her ridiculous explanation. I will explain how ridiculous the arguments she offered it is below:        Firstly, while Emily Jones attributed racehorses’ different kinds of injury to jockeys’ uses of whip, the fact was that many injured racehorses had the incident before the jockeys gave any signal to them to accelerate (and in many cases the jockeys had little choice but to stop their racehorses as soon as possible). Emily only showed the percentage of racehorses which were injured but not the research results about the correlation between whipping racehorses and making them injured, not to mention about what kind of source it is.        Indeed Australia has had the legal regulation to restrict the times of jockeys’ uses of whip in every race. This is not yet happened in Hong Kong and Japan, but these two places do not have as high racehorses’ death rates as the reported Australia’s one. One possible investigation direction can be whether the legal regulation is effective. But more important is that Emily proved nothing about what she wanted to say. There are many other reasons for racehorses to be injured. Say, if the condition of racehorses was not superb enough but they were forced to compete in the high level of race (consider the cases of DIVINE TEN, LUGAR and AEROVELOCITY in Hong Kong), or they competed too frequently, they would have the higher risk to be injured. This, again, is not highly related to the use of whip. I haven’t said that the use of whip must be irrelevant in any case, but based on Emily’s writing only, I cannot find any evidence or reasonable argument for supporting her claim that “all [horses] will be thrashed by a whip”. Further, Emily has little understanding about training the racehorses. As she wrote, “During training, these horses spend approximately 22 hours of every day alone in a stall the size of a bedroom, resulting in digestive and behavioural abnormalities. They are drugged to mask the pain from being overworked, and fed food with unnaturally high energy content.”        However, the fact is that the racehorses have different kinds of training, such as fast trotting, galloping, swimming, and using the walking machine. Though most of the racehorses do not have all kinds of training every day, there are at least some combinations of them in most of the days. In addition to it, they have to do some cool down exercises, and horse grooms have to wash and massage the racehorses quite frequently in order to make sure that their blood circulation remains good. It was certainly true that there might be some cases happened in the small provinces or villages of Australia which were quite matched with what Emily mentioned, but the better solution should be the implementation of the reasonable minimum requirements for all jockey clubs to organize races. Enlarging the sizes of stalls in Australia is not a difficult task since it is a big country. In addition to it, eating some “food with unnaturally high energy content” doesn’t necessary mean that the racehorses are being mistreated. Since the status of racehorses is equal to sportspersons, what they eat is sensibly different with what the other horses and the ordinary public eats. In the contemporary world, there is seldom a food which is completely natural, and whether the food has unnaturally high energy content is a matter of degree. For example, vitamin pills also contain unnaturally high energy content, but it is very normal for racehorses and sportspersons to eat them. Undoubtedly, there is the possibility that the trainers sacrifice the racehorses’ health in exchange for wins via feeding doping. Yet the most viable way of protecting the racehorses is to enhance the measuring of their body temperature, the taking of blood samples and urine samples for further testing in order to ensure that they are not fed by doping. Crucially, I quite disagree with Emily’s reason for supporting her claim that the racehorses are overworked. If all racehorses really spent 22 hours per day in their stalls, I'm afraid that I don't understand how they were being overworked. I, again, neither said that all racehorses are not overworked nor spent 22 hours per day in their stalls, but they are almost impossible to be happened simultaneously. One may further argue that it is possible for a racehorse to receive over-intense training for 2 hours, and then is “sentenced” to the stall for the remaining 22 hours. If the “golden formula” of training racehorses is “simple” to this extent, the trainers will have little worry about how to promote the condition of racehorses. Yet this is another oversimplification of the operation of training racehorses. It will be nonsense for the sensible trainers to train the racehorses with high intensity at all times, especially when the race of a racehorse is approaching (1 to 2 days before the race) or when they are in the off-reason. And in comparison, the intensity of training is somehow lower than the intensity of race. Those who have common sense about training racehorses will know that racehorses need not have the training of the intensity of race in order to maintain good condition. Having the training of the intensity of race is nonsense because racehorses will thus spend long time to recover or recuperate. It is also naïve to believe that all racehorses “are drugged to mask the pain from being overworked”. The primary aim of wearing gear, such as blinker with one cowl only, hood, pacifier with cowls, pacifier with 1 cowl, shadow roll, sheepskin cheek pieces, visor, sheepskin browband and sheepskin cheek piece 1 side, is to do the utmost to ensure that the racehorses feel comfortable to and concentrate on racing, but not all racehorses can adapt to wear any gear. There are numerous racehorses which do not wear any gear to race, though it doesn’t necessary mean that they are not feed by doping. More importantly, the vets have to check the racehorses which run into the first two position (sometimes include the 3rd) and which performance is unusually improved or bad soon after the race (usually within 15 minutes), which need to take off their gear. In this arrangement, it is unbelievable that the vets cannot find that the checked racehorses “are drugged to mask the pain from being overworked” if there is any. Finally, Emily’s understanding about the career of racehorses was absurd. In fact, “the average ‘career’ of a racehorse is 3 years” quite makes the common sense of horse racing because the majority of them could only maintain in the top forms for less than 3 years, especially those super precocious racehorses. When they are retired, the elite racehorses with breeding ability will be sent to different pastures for breeding purpose. Most of the other elite racehorses without breeding ability will be sent to a variety of ranches for having relaxed life until they die. I can say extending their career is crueller than retiring them.        While this luck only belongs to the elite class, there are still many other options for handling the remaining racehorses after their retirement, such as changing them for horsemanship, public riding or even tourism purpose. Saying the cruel words like the numbers of racehorse being ‘discarded’ (25,000 per year [1]) are obviously smaller than that of the numbers of pig, cow and sheep does not contribute to the fruitful discussion of this issue. After all, any excessive killing is morally condemnable. But we have to ask why the racehorses are killed for feeding the dogs especially when their meat does not have higher nutritional values than other types of meat to the dogs. If the reason was that their price is cheaper, the solution should be impose a taxation of selling racehorses’ meat to subsidise the development of protecting racehorses. The taxation can also be imposed to the owners who sell/transfer their racehorse(s) to the food manufacturers so as to make the costs of selling/transferring for eating purpose higher than the costs of keeping their racehorses. If there are some other reasons for causing it, careful investigation should be launched in order to avoid jumping to the conclusion hastily that horse racing is the main reason for the large amounts of racehorses being killed for the eating purpose. It is certainly true that animal rights activists advocate the ban of eating meat, and I am personally beyond doubt standing on the side of against eating racehorses’ meat even if there was only 1 racehorse being eaten per year because I love racehorses, but there is no evidence to suggest that horse racing results in higher rates of eating meat. It is easy to imagine that it's not difficult to forbid the racehorses to be killed for the eating purpose, and it is perhaps worthwhile to do so, but the intensity and the amounts of eating meat will not decrease because of this measure. So please re-consider the argument(s) if one really wants to protect the racehorses. These kinds of arguments will "assist" the jockey clubs to win easily in the "judicial review" (if any).   Note: [1] Thanks my university friend, Billy Lai-lok HEUNG, for sharing me Jeff Dowsing’s article titled “The cruelty of the Melbourne Cup” which was published in The Guardian on 30 November 2013 (Wednesday).
title: Only Having the Passion for Protecting Racehorses Is Not Enough

text: 今日我哋講咗…… ●沈祖堯撕下斯文面具　搣海報滅毒 ●劉鳴煒笑港獨幼稚　變相倒林鄭米 ●震驚六百萬人　有大學請吳得掂做教授
title: 852直播室（2017-09-15）主持：昇爺、Ches(小小姐)

text: 勞工及福利局局長張建宗表示，綜援個案數字，已連續第 64個月下跌，現個案宗數為 24.1萬宗，為 2001年4月以來的新低，其中失業綜援個案連續 83個月下跌、低收入個案連續 89個月下跌；張建宗認為，上述數字反映只要就業市場穩定，「很多健全的受助人都會選擇自力更生」。 張建宗今日發表網誌披露，24.1萬宗個案中，年老個案佔六成，永久殘疾、健康欠佳及單親個案佔約三成，失業綜援個案數字，則連續第83個月下跌，現約1.5萬宗，佔總數 6.3%，為1997年5月以來最低。 網誌又提到，目前香港 117萬名65歲或以上的長者人口，有84萬為公共福利金（包括長者生活津貼、生果金等）或綜援受助人，佔總數72%。 網誌總結，今個財政年度的社會保障經常開支預計為 421億元，即約每日發放 1.15億元，佔政府開支12.1%。
title: 綜援個案見2001年新低　張建宗：健全受助人都選擇自力更生

text: 上星期，有幾個大學生嚟咗我間律師樓，實習大約兩星期。佢哋大部份都又叻又醒又曾經出國留學，重點係，都有家底。眾所＿知，律師樓同摩根大通、滙豐、和麥肯錫等機構一樣，收實習生有時係討好某啲人例如客戶嘅手段之一。比起佢哋，出身草根嘅學生，想搵份似樣啲嘅實習做下，真係要多啲努力同多好多運氣。 問題係，當啲官員大部份都唔接地氣、當佢哋身邊嘅年輕人都係來自有錢送仔女去非一帶一路地區讀書嘅富裕家庭、當佢哋一年幾套來回美國機票嘅錢已經可以夠本地大學畢業生還大半學債嘅時候，佢哋又點明白一般本地學生幾咁需要資助、點會了解普通市民其實係有幾咁需要一帶一路獎學金嗰10億呢？ 先唔好講香港點解需要錢解決本地教育制度問題，當務之急係，香港學校要錢嚟搞掂啲綠化天台同供水系統！假如師生隨時都可能被倒塌嘅僭建天花「dup」死、校園入面嘅人生命安全都冇保障，仲講咩去非洲交流？仲有，學校最緊要確保供水安全，老師同學飲嘅水含鉛量唔會超標，如果唔係飲壞腦仲點歡迎由中東嚟香港嘅交留生？嗱，本地學生出事事小，一帶一路地區交流生喺香港被僭建天花「dup」親同被鉛水毒親，搞到政治獻媚不成反而丟阿爺假事大！ 講笑還講笑，事實上本地教育同其他民生議題點解比一帶一路獎學金更急切地需要嗰10億，我都唔想嘥＿氣講，反正嗰個想連任嘅人都唔會聽，聽咗都唔會理。我飲大兩杯之後甚至會諗，長痛不如短痛，可唔可以簡單啲一筆過比10億呢個人當送瘟神咁送走佢呢？ 我問啲實習生點睇一帶一路獎學金。結果係個個都冇咩反應……可能係我嘅問題啦；又可能係讀書加實習已經令佢哋冇時間關心其他嘢；又可能係佢哋嘅教育令佢哋比較小心，唔會喺工作間表露太多個人感受啩；又可能係佢哋已經得道，看破紅塵。不過我唔理，無論點，我都希望儘量同佢哋傾多啲，盡下公民教育嘅責任，因為我相信，「十年未晚」。 （撰文：Stephanie Matias＠法政匯思）（圖片來源：政府新聞網）
title: 律師樓實習生、一帶一路獎學金│法政匯思網誌

text: 港鐵南港島線將於今年年底通車，絕對是飽受香港仔隧道塞車的南區居民之福，無疑問的是大批居民將用腳投票轉投港鐵。 但港鐵新增的乘客，有不少將會是「被港鐵」的。政府奉行「鐵路為本」，一味只懂削減路面交通，全無鼓勵競爭及分流的概念，港鐵迫爆便是傾斜政策的惡果。本年通車的新鐵路線除南港島線後，亦有觀塘線延線至何文田及黃埔，署方公佈的通車後巴士重組計劃，亦是一味削班減線。然而在鐵路線面前，巴士是否便毫無競爭力？運輸署及巴士公司是否應該積極一點、宏觀一點？ 昨日南區區議會交通及運輸委員會，討論本年度巴士路線計劃，議員不滿運輸署在港鐵通車前重組巴士路線，通過擱置討論。不過以署方官僚態度，料將只有兩個結果：不理議會強推計劃上馬，抑或持放棄態度，待港鐵通車後放任巴士公司放棄南區巴士市場。 區議會擱置討論，坦白說：有點失望。雖然署方及巴士公司會私下找議員商討，但區議會始終是公開會議，擱置便等於放棄於公眾層面辯論。當然，議員們的不滿亦可以理解。 運輸署在2013年首次提出南港島線通車後的巴士重組計劃，建議大幅削減路線及減少班次，在2014年曾更新一次，料下月將公佈建議的最終方案。根據2014年9月版本，黃竹坑區方面，75（深灣至中環）改為只於早上開出3班、71（黃竹坑至中環）取消、107在早上繁忙時段不經黃竹坑。在鴨利洲，署方建議取消91（鴨利洲邨至中環）、94X（利東至中環）、90C（鴨利洲大街至中環）及590A（海怡半島至金鐘）、671（利樂街至鑽石山）改經紅隧並只提供上雨午各3班服務以及90（鴨利洲邨至中環）及97（利東至中環）兩線改為灣仔循環線，不再以中環為總站。 目前南區巴士服務，面對的情況一如2002年地鐵將軍澳線通車前夕，當年地鐵通車後，巴士乘客大量流失，多條巴士路線均須減班甚至削線。將軍澳隧道亦因區內人口上升愈加擠塞，巴士公司對區內服務持半放棄態度。 然而這是否表示將軍澳區巴士無得做？港鐵開通十年後，新巴開辦往沙田的798及九巴經公開招標後開辦的往荃灣的290／290A均甚受歡迎，原因為港鐵前往上述該兩區須多次轉線，時間上亦沒有輸蝕太大。 當然，南區並無將軍澳區般近10年急升的人口、港鐵將軍澳線擠迫及將軍澳隧道相對香港仔隧道較暢順等優勢，但將軍澳的例子亦可給南區一點啟示，南港島線開通後絕不代表南區巴士服務再無可為，何況南區的黃竹坑亦同時是新興的商貿區，近年上班的人流不斷增加。南區區議會要求港鐵通車不重組巴士路線，雖然可以理解，但如不在港鐵通車前提早改善巴士服務，乘客流失後將一去不返。 增加點對點路線 兩條將軍澳區新巴士線往沙田及荃灣的成功之處，均在於「點對點」及針對港鐵須多次轉線及車程長的弱點。南港島線連接金鐘，直接轉駁荃灣線及港島線，對於鴨利洲前往上環、中環、金鐘及九龍半島的巴士服務影響最大。 相對之下，由南區前往九龍東、港島東兩個新興的商貿區，以及新界區則須多次轉線或須「走回頭路」，巴士公司可增強這些地區的服務。 以港島東為例，日後港鐵由海怡半島經金鐘往鰂魚涌，官方車程為24分鐘，須轉線一次。目前早上繁忙時間前往港島東的特別路線77X（華貴至鰂魚涌）及99X（海怡半島至西灣河），由總站直達北角約須40至45分鐘，雖然略慢，但無須迫港鐵及多次上落，仍具競爭力，可提早加班「爭客」。目前兩線均不設回程，原因為往南區的道路設計必須與往紅隧車輛及銅鑼灣景隆街「打交」，但其實亦可創意一點，回程停鰂魚涌後經英皇道而不停站，並依交通情況經景隆街、怡和街或禮頓道入香港仔隧道。 九龍東方面，港鐵由海怡半島經金鐘、北角、油塘往觀塘，官方車程為36分鐘，但須轉線3次。目前由鴨利洲往往觀塘區的671（利樂街至鑽石山），死症是途經銅鑼灣、北角然後才進入東隧，加上班次不穩，十分「趕客」，671應改行較直接的東區走廊，觀察客量變化。107（華貴至九龍灣）亦不應只構思如何放棄黃竹坑區，而應抽調部份班次過紅隧口後改經東九龍走廊，直達九龍灣商貿區。 971（石排灣至海麗邨）的重組，亦應與走線老化、須繞經銅鑼灣及途經多條繁忙路段的170（華富至沙田）一併考慮，增加由香港仔經西隧、青沙公路直達沙田的路線，估計至大圍車程可以在40分鐘內，吸引南區往新界東及轉乘港鐵北上的乘客。沙田居民亦可有全日經青沙公路及西隧的巴士線，方便轉乘其他路線前往港島中部及西部。 轉乘優惠 南區居民長期而對繁忙時間上車難的問題，「執生」能力高，例如在下午繁忙時間，南區居民懂得「有車上車」，然後在黃竹坑轉車。另一類「轉車客」，則是在黃竹坑轉乘其他路線往他區，如油麻地往香港仔的乘客會先乘171（海怡半島至荔枝角）再在黃竹坑轉車。巴士公司應提供各路線免費轉乘優惠，令香港仔及鴨利洲兩邊的巴士路線網絡能夠整合。 加快車程 隨黃竹坑商貿局發展，上班人流愈來愈多，日後港鐵站開通後會再增加轉乘鐵路的乘客，巴士公司應善用黃竹坑道天橋，把現有路線改道途經，避過兩組交通燈及停站擠塞，例如38（置富花園至北角）、97（利東至中環）、590A（海怡半島至金鐘）可改為來回均途經天橋，亦可增加部份路線在繁忙時段取道天橋，如下午繁忙時間的42（華富至北角）等。 運輸署亦不應逃避責任，在政策上支持巴士與港鐵並行，例如在香港仔隧道設立巴士專用通道，在隧道間封期間優先供巴士通行；延長香港仔隧道收費廣場前的巴士專線時間等；收緊審批在繁忙時段期間使用隧道的非專營巴士及小巴路線。
title: 南港島線通車在即 巴士減班削線居民「被港鐵」

text: It’s the Year of the Rooster in 2017, wishing everyonehere a prosperous LUNAR New Year! Yes, it’s LUNAR NEW YEAR, and it’s NOT chinese newyear! Each and every year, there are signs everywhere that says “chinese newyear”. Yet, no one seems to know that the Lunar New Year is celebrated not justin china, but in also Hong Kong, Taiwan, Vietnam, Korea, Singapore, Malaysia,Indonesia, Thailand and even Japan once. Where then did “chinese new year” come from? Sure, thechinese does make it a big thing, but that hardly means they own it. Moreover,the Lunar Calendar may have originated in the region now known as china, but itwas an amalgamation and refinement of many tribal and ethnic agriculturalcalendars throughout the centuries, chiefly by the various Sino-empires thathas risen and fell in the region, inherited by the Republic of China and theprc; however, that doesn’t warrant the chinese taking sole ownership of it.This is cultural imperialism, and thoroughly insulting to other Asian ethnicitiesby denying them the right to claim ownership of the Lunar Calendar. Surprisingly,in an age of political correctness, this wholly politically incorrectterminology is employed without anyone battering an eyelid; and we can findnon-Christians lambasting Christianity of hijacking the pagan celebration ofthe winter solstice by calling it Christmas, however, no one says a thing about“chinese new year” hijacking other Asian ethnic nations’ “Lunar New Year”. Itis hypocrisy. I can hear some people now bitch to me, saying “Whoreally cares? It’s just a word, why make a big deal of it?” Words are criticalin shaping our thoughts, and the use of terminology can influence how weperceive our world. It is like learning a language as a child, the words ispart of an established social framework, and by learning and employing thewords, one then affirms it and strengthen its role as a social adhesive thatbinds our perception of how the world is. Once a particular view is set in ourminds, it cannot readily accept realities that deviate from their views. So bycalling it “chinese new year”, we are taking part in china’s culturalimperialism and ethnic cleansing, a bloodless and silent part of that church ofsatan’s genocide against the greater East and Southeast Asian region. What can we do? Personally, we can start by insistingon calling it Lunar New Year when those around us use the wrong term, but donot be obnoxious about it. If someone enquires why the different term, then beready to give your short explanation about it, but without malice, as mostpeople do not know what they do. Another thing that we can do, is submitcomment cards to your local shopping centres and department stores thatperpetrates this chinese cultural imperialist term, correcting their usage andexplaining that they are being participants of cultural genocide, again with courtesy.I can say it now that it will feel pointless, but as with all bad habits thatneeds correction, it takes time. Now everyone say it after me: Happy LUNAR New Year!
title: Happy LUNAR New Year!

text: 「獅子山精神」關「唱」鍾樹根乜嘢事？
title: 源視物語：葉國謙示範，點樣由獅子山檻過八仙嶺

text: 尼日利亞最大城市拉各斯的中國商城   在蔡英文走訪中美洲四邦交國之際，西非大國尼日利亞，突令台灣駐該國首都阿布賈的經貿辦事處「摘牌更名、遷出首都、削權減人」，並斬斷雙方任何官方往來。中國對此大加讚賞，隨即宣布在尼國再投資400億美元。但此舉令台灣輿論大為愕然，斥其「混淆視聽」，因尼台雙方本來就無外交關係，該國僅承認中華人民共和國。 隨著台灣前友邦聖多美和普林西比棄台迎中，標誌兩岸「外交休兵」默契已不復再，台灣面對斷交潮陰霾，甚至連無邦交的尼日利亞也不留情面地來一招「斷上斷」，其國際空間固然日益受壓。   中國工廠辦公大樓   中台外交戰蔓延到非洲，反映了這裡的重要性，此地已不再是公眾印象中只乞求援助救濟的黑暗大陸。相反，在新的全球格局下，中國需靠非洲來拓展國際空間，而非洲亦要中國來平衡它與其他投資者的談判力量。中非互相依賴程度提升，非洲將對中國發展越來越舉足輕重。在剛過去的聖誕假期，筆者到訪尼日利亞，探望在當地中國自貿區工作的西安朋友，藉此實地觀察和分析一下中國的「非洲戰略」究竟是怎樣一回事。 尼日利亞是非洲人口最多的國家，達1.8億，亦是非洲最大經濟體。根據2014年英國廣播公司BBC的調查，尼國是全世界最支持中國的國家，85%國民對中國感覺正面。筆者親身到訪該國最大城市拉各斯和其他小鎮，感受到當地人對華人的友善，而且中菜也是當地最受歡迎的外國菜。 尼日利亞於1960年脫英獨立後，內戰頻生，其間台灣派員拉攏邦交，但始終不果，到了1971年尼國才跟中國建交。這是因為上世紀70年代尼國軍事獨裁和侵犯人權遭西方譴責，急於尋求中國作其石油出口市場。   到中國工廠上班的尼日利亞工人   此後兩國一直保持緊密關係，如在2015年，尼日利亞提出爭取聯合國安理會常任理事國席位，中國也明確支持（儘管安理會改革遙遙無期）。因此，它對中國在亞太地區的爭端都持親中態度。可見尼國對沒實質國際地位的台灣採取「斷上斷」做法，亦只是再次確定中尼「戰略夥伴關係」，全無顧慮台方反應。 在意識形態和政治制度方面，雖然台灣高舉亞洲民主價值，而尼日利亞也是民主國家，但後者對「民主」其實不太感興趣，如該國現任總統布哈里就曾靠軍事政變奪位。民主是舉國官員腐敗不堪的藉口，其行為因有人民授權而得到正當性，令幻想破滅的當地人質疑民主與發展是否存在互相促進的關係。有尼國官員曾表明要以一黨專政的中共為榜樣，可見中尼政體差異沒有妨礙交往，台灣民主「軟實力」對非洲國家沒多大吸引力。   自貿區內的中國員工宿舍   中尼關係的重要性在經濟方面最能體現。目前中國在非洲有6個特別經濟區，其中兩個在尼日利亞，另外4個分別在埃及、埃塞俄比亞、贊比亞、毛里求斯。這種特別經濟區旨在用優惠政策吸引投資，可視作把深圳經濟特區的例子在非洲作實驗。而筆者到訪的「奧貢廣東自由貿易區」，位於該國西南部，在9年前設立，佔地20平方公里，現有約20間工廠。 這裡給我的第一感覺是治安嚴謹，所有訪客都要提前申請訪客證，任何人士和車輛進入都要逐一檢查登記。在尼日利亞這個治安不佳、交通混亂、腐敗橫行的國家，這裡可說是少有的安全地帶。 可是，當地政府設立了自貿區，卻是金玉其外，連最基本的道路也完全無心修好，貨車經過之處全是月球表面般的爛泥路，阻礙運貨又影響安全。中國工廠唯有自己出資，把自貿區內的道路鋪好。區內一條條平滑乾淨的水泥路，簡直給人回到現代世界的喜悅。此外，區內尼日利亞員工除了說該國官方語言英文外，也說約魯巴語和少許中文，而中國員工則少有離開園區，且未必會說英文。 《經濟學人》曾訪問當地黑人廠商，他們認為，長遠來說不想一直依靠中國廉價產品，而希望學習中國製造技術再在本地生產。他們在跟中國人做生意的五十多年間，感覺到跟歐美相比，中國不隱藏自己技術，較少版權專利問題，亦不要求特殊待遇，雙方地位較為平等，這讓他們樂意以「中國模式」為榜樣。這些自貿區是中國近年「一帶一路」政策的實踐，在快速發展的亞非合作領域搶佔先機。   奧貢廣東自貿區附近的Igbesa村莊   然而，從中國人觀點來看，非洲最大的危險就是腐敗。非洲各國制度缺失，使得中國企業歷來採用從上到下的管理方法難以實行。這解釋了為何中國在10多年前計劃在非洲設50個自貿區，但現時進展緩慢，只建立了6個。 對於中國在尼日利亞以至非洲其他新興國家的影響力，視中國為對手的西方國家當然不會坐視不理，主要論點有斥責中國滲透當地經濟，搞「新殖民主義」。例子有《紐約時報》一篇名為《尼日利亞，中國投資援建陰影之下》的文章。該文報道「中國製造」的次貨如何觸發火災，摧毁當地人的家園和生意；又講述中國製造業如何把當地小企業趕盡殺絕，激發部分民情反彈，引伸出北京全球戰略在尼國受挫的結論。由此可見，西方媒體和主流意識對中國於非洲的影響力都十分提防，且沒有好感。 經貿合作需要人才，而中國企業在非洲創造的就業機會，也讓很多當地人意識到中文的用處。兩國當前積極推動文化和學術交流、設立相關機構，為數眾多的尼日利亞學生對學習中文，以至去中國升學都甚有興趣，且認為大有前途，但中國人對黑人的歧視令他們望而卻步。 成為大國的其中一個條件是對文化和種族差異的包容，隨著兩國教育水平進步，並與其他發展中國家人民有更多接觸交流機會，有望可改善在國民層面上的雙方印象。這種印象改變包括了解中國和非洲關係的意義，避免大眾以為中非關係就是向非洲送錢換邦交的觀感。   則留言
title: 尼日利亞跟台灣「斷上斷」與中國的非洲戰略

text: 今年係香港保衛戰七十五周年。1941年12月8日，日本偷襲珍珠港嘅第二日，日軍正式由廣東南進香港。香港守軍，分別來自英國、本土、印度以及加拿大。加拿大出兵兩營，一共二千人。係香港保衛戰之中，加拿大犠牲290人，另外差唔多1,500人係英國投降之後淪為戰俘，直至1945年日本投降之後先至獲釋。 加拿大政府為咗紀念香港保衛戰，將會係年底推出紀念銀幣。紀念戰爭英烈，本係每個社會份內之事。但係香港嘅特殊政治環境之下，史實卻被清洗，實在非常可惜。紀念英烈，目的並非歌頌現政權，而係要每一代都記得，自由得來不易，更非永恒。追思歷史，懷念上代為自己曾經付出；同時亦需思考，自己可以為下一代付出咩野。 《想像共同體》認為，建國神話可以令一群人分出敵我，但係是否形成民族，下一個測試就係會否為共同體其他人付出。假如自稱民族，但係年輕人遠離政治，絕對利己；做生意損人利己，不顧小朋友健康，亦不顧環境影響；有權有勢，就將財產甚至家人外移；其實都在在證明，民族論述尚未完善，雖稱同胞，但民眾並冇當大家係自己人。 1997年亞洲金融風暴，韓國民眾響應政府，捐出黃金以穩定國家財政。如果單以囚徒困境而論，每一名韓國民眾嘅最佳策略都係其他人捐出黃金，自己唔捐，因而結果應該係所有人都唔捐，以致韓圜無法穩定，形成最差結果。但係韓國民眾反而集體救國，就係各人明白到成個國家係一個整體，需要共同捍衛。 再扯遠少少，七八十年代台灣同韓國嘅民主運動，有死有傷，有財產損失，有監禁經年，都係兩代之中，無數人付出個人代價之後，先至逐漸有成果。如果每個人都係「精緻的利己主義者」，就會回到囚徒困境：每個人嘅最佳策略都係等隔籬果個抗爭，自己就繼續搵錢，到咗功成之日，就坐享其成。將民主、自由、法治視為普世價值，最大問題係會令人忘記，只有不斷捍衛，自由先會扎根。 香港民眾，本來對中華民族都有熱情。三十年來嘅建設民主中國，幾起賑災籌款，都係香港民眾願意為中華民族付出。只係大家發現，原來對方根本未當你係自己人，所以先會熱情冷卻。 而且更重要嘅醒覺，係發現香港人要捍衛同發展嘅華夏文化，根本同政治上中國人身份無關，甚至有所衝突。保存儒家文明，日本台灣做得更好，反而擁抱政治中國人嘅身份，就要面對「現代中國人」經歷過破四舊，立四新，儒家文明曾係鬥爭對像嘅歷史。更具體嘅表現，就成為咗今日嘅漢粵語之爭同正殘體之爭。當中爭論點其實係點解香港人要做政治中國人，就要放棄流傳幾百年，並且先輩以現代方式，經已發展咗幾十年嘅香港文化？點解以華夏歷史、儒家經典、粵語正體所形成嘅華夏文明分支，必需被清洗？本土主義、分離思想得以萌芽，就係有人意識到，只有中港區隔，先有機會保存香港發展嘅嘅有文化。 要融入中國人價值體系，就要接受鴉片戰爭係中華民族嘅屈辱，英國人係邪惡嘅殖民者，而無視英國人經營香港一百五十年，引入法治同公務員系統；無視英聯邦友邦，如加拿大，曾為香港犠牲；無視幾位港督，根治貪污、建立公屋、大興基建等歷史功績。結果就係依二十年來，香港出現比以前更燥動，更無根嘅狀態：政府唔可強推北京政權嘅優越性，只可以貶低香港自己嘅既有歷史，結果就係香港出現咗建國神話嘅真空。 本土主義，最根本嘅性質就係香港擁有獨有嘅文化、歷史、同價值觀，值得我地共同捍衛發展。金庸梁羽生筆下嘅文化中國，係上一輩遠離故土嘅學者嘅想像，係混入香港現代思想嘅烏托邦。泛民嘅未來民主中國，甚或蔣介石嘅「三民主義，統一中國」，只係空中樓閣，甚至係當地民眾之中，亦唔見得特別有支持。謂之離地，就係因為兩類思想，都同現實脫節。 與其捍衛虛無飄渺嘅主張，不如致力發展現世香港。亦唯有如此，行動先會有確實目標，繼而可以規劃路線圖同成果。齊撐港隊，保衛傑志中心；發展本土電影；保衛粵語同正體字；宣揚貼地文化，如最近出現嘅食物明信片；全部都係發展嘅一部份。發展香港身份，係冇單一配方，而係好似幫佛像上金漆一樣，靠好多人一層又一層咁掃上去，先會慢慢成型。 有部份活動，我地民間有能力做到；其他則要借助外力。加拿大政府紀念香港保衛戰，除咗係友邦自己嘅歷史承傳之外，客觀上亦為香港保留咗一段歷史。英國亦有收藏英治時代嘅歷史文獻。借力英聯邦友邦，對保留香港歷史原貌，實在有所裨益。
title: 香港保衛戰竟要靠加拿大政府承傳

text: ——寫給七一                                          堂前風捲走了鞋履 還可以關上門緊唸大悲咒 千手千眼如是 呼號換氣如換詞 設想一旱雷，光天下 光著腳光著腳在點 一盞燈一盞燈 的影子 雷是虛的我們的恐懼愈實在 蟬聲穿堂脊而寒 如果蛻衣的作用只是 覆疊蛻衣 我們該下一個什麼字 可以連聒噪的蟬聲也刺穿？ 雨在沒有行動中行動了 雨把傘連起又教它們消失 雨把消失了的又喚回來 雨把行動中的凝在一個切面裡 雨把行動中的凝在一個切面裡 電在小小的屏幕中點算數字 憤怒悲哀都成了臉譜 當大人們予取予攜 我們只剩下了 打之無盡的小人 承擔不輕了我們的街 的道，讓鞋履都在盡功德 而腳，獨獨在盡無盡的遊戲 2016年6月29日 （原刊於《明報》世紀版，2016年7月1日）
title: 獨腳戲
